description: I always try to order pizza from different places and they always disappoint.   The service at NB is shit and their pizza is room temperature when it arrives, but it still tastes better than anything else in SF.  Worth having to microwave it when it arrives.
author: Amie B.

description:
A former staple in the community, this north beach pizza was often visited by city kids like me who had just finished track practice over at kezar, mid Friday night football game down at the stadium or the pro am games at the gym literally across the street or even just mobbin' on haight after school. But due to the culture change of this city and the unfortunate changeover of NorthBeach's management, this establishment has gone to shit. 

Walked in at 830pm on a Friday night to grab a slice or two with friends, and this PIZZA place, that advertises and supposedly serves PIZZA by the slice, did not have any pizza available. How on a Friday night during football season you have no pizza in a pizza by the slice shop is beyond me, but no problem, ask when slices would be available gentleman at the front says 10minutes. Step outside and wait 15 minutes and walk back in, still no pizza. Other delivery drivers and patrons alike now are waiting at the counter as the manager tells me only pepperoni slices will be coming out. We wait another 15 minutes and finally I see a pizza come out the oven. Awesome, the pizza chef puts the pizza in the spinning display case as the manager is working on the register. Patiently our now band of brothers type line of customers waits as he fumbles through delivery orders and receipts. 

Not much place in the establishment to stand so as I am directly in front of the register staring at the now spinning pizza, I await the managers gaze so we can continue our transaction. Not only did this unprofessional amateur ignore me, he proceeds to brush by, walk directly past me to leave the register as I'm standing there, to walk to the back and fumble up some other mess. I, at that moment, a patron who waited patiently, no attitude, quiet just hoping for a slice of pizza, hit my shit experience limit. After another few minutes, As there is now clearly a line and no one at the register I audibly say "yoo I been standing here waiting 45 minutes and there is now literally a pizza spinning in my face. Can I get a slice or what?!"

Manager has the nerve to ask me to wait again and continues to ignore customers in the restaurant. He finally comes back and asks me what I want. At this point, it is pretty clear that the manager or register attendant who I really hope is not an owner, gave no shits about the type of experience his customers had. At this point I buy all the slices of pepperoni for our group, and as I walk out with our full pizza, the manager, not sure from where exactly, pulls out other slices with a variety of toppings to place in the display case. At this point I just wanted food and to get back to our football game, but it would be a disservice to my community and all the good people who used to enjoy this establishment if I did not comment on the lack of empathy, service, logic, and operational aptitude. Is 0 stars a thing?
author: Darren L.

description:
If you want to surprise them, walk into their place, a pizza place which advertises as selling  pizza and order pizza during business hours. 

Plain pizza. A sign blinking on the outside says slices. No pizza. I apologized for the expectations.
author: Jane S.

description:
Even before I had stepped foot inside their doors (or eaten their pizza, for that matter), I was already all too familiar with North Beach Pizza.  In no small part because I've passed by this particular location countless times over the years.  Yet, for whatever reason, it didn't seems like any of my friends or family had actually ordered pizzas from here.  So, of course it would make perfect sense that my relatives would suddenly ask me to bring over some pizzas from here, right?

While I'd always known this North Beach Pizza was small, I never knew it was THIS small (blink as you drive by and you'll miss it).  Their spot in North Beach may be an actual restaurant (from the photos, at least), but this is definitely more of a grab-and-go/delivery type of spot.  Though, given the neighborhood's parking situation, that might not be the worst thing...

-- COIT TOWER - Fresh Mushrooms, Pepperoni, Salami, and Italian Sausage...$31.35 (large)
(https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/north-beach-pizza-san-francisco-4?select=NC3-4Z-lvcMYg9kDaDlnAg)
Essentially a meat lover's pizza...but with mushrooms.  As a whole, the meats were decently plentiful and flavorful.  However, everything else fell short - some of the mushrooms were a little mealy, the sauce was super generic (read: not good), and the crust was very thick and tasteless.

-- CABLE CAR - Creamy Garlic Sauce, Chicken, Bacon Pieces, Fresh Tomatoes, Green Onions...$27.40 (medium)
(https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/north-beach-pizza-san-francisco-4?select=kEMwJs8JKmOKREdY4hU3hA)
The better of the two, but it still underwhelmed.  Though the sauce wasn't bad, and despite the chicken and bacon, the dough sucked up all of the other flavors with how thick and bland it was.  What's more, the tomatoes made both the taste and texture of the pizza really watery/wet.

Considering how they have a number of locations around the Bay Area (though, their site only lists three), North Beach Pizza is practically a chain...except not nearly as good.  I don't recall Domino's or Pizza Hut being worse, but Round Table is definitely better by leaps and bounds.  Plus, while their menu does have a wider array of options to choose from, the prices here are notably high, especially for the quality you're getting.

In any case, the silver lining to all of this is that I now know someone who has tried these guys, but really, that's about it.  Pass.
author: Mike L.

description: The pizza was tasty but nothing spectacular. The slice I got was kind of warm. Nice thick crust and flavorful sauce. I'm pretty sure if I ordered a whole fresh pie the quality would be much better.
author: Ty S.

description: This is a great place.  We have been here each time we visit the city.  The pizza is really good and the service is very friendly.  This last trip we arrived on a Sunday at 5pm and we were able to walk in and get a table.  No way we could do that at the other 'popular" spots.
author: Ryan D.

description: Needed a snack before dinner but they only had 3 types: mushroom, cheese and pesto. How do you not have pepperoni at 7 pm. The mushroom was aright but it had a little bit too doughey. Pricey too, $8.xx for 2 slices.
author: James H.

description: Love this place for take out/delivery.  Have tried a lot of the menu.  Sausage and Mushroom pizza - really good.  Chicken Wings Napolitano excellent, large wings with onion and peppers, Chicken Milanese, Minestrone soup, even the Appetizer sampler is pretty good.  Pastas - all very good.  Delivery is usually on time and food hot.
author: Janet C.

description: My pasta dish was literally dry over-fried pieces of sausage and penne floating in tomato water. I've had minestrone soup less watery, and I've had water more flavorful. Cherry on top: said tomato water dripping down my clothes as I carry the poorly packaged pick-up order home... I used to frequent this place, but I doubt I'll ever go back again.
author: Bruk M.

description:
Why are you sending coupons you don't even accept? I tried to order the Single Deal for 16.99 and was told I can't get that because they didn't put it in the computer yet.
The guy on the phone was dismissive and didn't try to remedy the situation at all.
I live in the neighborhood but I don't think I'll ever get pizza from them again.
author: jessica c.

description: Stopped in 2 grab a quick slice while out for a walk. Pizza was ready by the slice and absolutely delicious! Little pricey, it was $15 for 2 slices and 2 bottle of water. The person who served was also super rude which I can do without. Overall, great for a quick slice and in and out!
author: Ashlee A.

description:
I ordered a family deal: 2 pizzas and cokes along with a couple of side appetizers on Saturday, 9/23. The delivery was absolutely on time, which was really awesome. But when I unpacked my orders, everything was there except for the cokes, supposed to be 5 cokes as described. Not a big deal as we still enjoyed the pizzas and the appetizers. 
I contacted yelp/eat 24, for which I got an immediate apology and a small credit to my account. 
Will still order from them. Just hope they can be more careful about customers' orders.
author: Kevin C.

description:
Beautiful hawaiian pizza from here today 6/18/16. Was at Free Gold Watch (pinball arcade) nearby and tried this for the first time today as its nearby.... a friend got it who lives in the area.

Limited review for food only - not for restaurant ambiance, service, etc. Ate at friends home.

High quality ingredients. Great crust. Delicious cheese. It was particularly appreciated as I had Mustafos a day or two before. Pizza quality like night and day compared to Mustafos.

As my yelp mission to find the best pizza in the city is well underway Ive already tried lots of great places: Firetrail, Tonys, GoldenBoy, Mozzeria, Little Star, Paxtis.... and this place is in the race. I can say that with confidence. Good stuff. Dont hesitate... come try it.
author: Stefan T.

description:
This is a decent pizza place. It is an extremely small/ cramped location. There is no seating inside. You can stand inside and eat a slice of pizza, however you will be bumped into as people walk in and out. 
The pizza quality is decent. The San Mateo location trumps this location.
The price is a bit too high for my liking. $32 for a large 3 topping pizza. It's funny how the same pizza is $24 at the location on Taraval. 
The flavor is good. A lot of cheese. The crust is good.
I would order again from here if their prices were a little less. I would expect and XL pizza to be over $30 here in SF.
Overall, north beach pizza works.
author: Kevin S.

description: I've driven past this place a billion times..and what a fool I was...finally had dinner here ..guys so so good I can't believe it. Go today
author: Emily S.

description:
We've had North Beach pizza in the past and overall we've been pretty satisfied. But this past weekend was a downer. I understand that it was a big weekend (NBA championship) so it was probably even more of a test. 

The estimated delivery time was late by 30 min. When you have a house full of hungry fans, we all take the estimated delivery time to heart. Maybe an under promise but over deliver would have been a better option for them. After checking on delivery time twice, we finally got our pizza. The pizza must have been driving around SF because the box was soggy and the cheese had already began to get hard. Yes, you've been there. It was at the point where you would take a bite but the entire toppings layer would slide right off since the pizza was sitting.

I guess we'll stick to our local Goat Hill Pizza.
author: Mark M.

description: North beach pizza is the best pizza place. Ordered for a delivery and it was prompt and the food was awesome. The delivery driver AD was very nice and kind enough to bring the food upstairs. Thanks!!!
author: Adithya R.

description: It's OK. I mean, it's edible. What I think is that it is a money laundering operation for the Russian mob in SF. No, I'm not nuts and I'm not kidding.  The pizza is so blah, I can't imagine they are staying open just selling pie.  And what pizza joint closes at 10:00 pm? Give me a break.
author: Anne S.

description:
Ordered via Eat 24 and took about 50 minutes for it to deliver.

The pizza was all right. What I thought that was annoying was that the toppings kept falling off.  The flavor wasn't that great as well so I had to put some hot sauce and ranch on top of it for me to enjoy it.

The crust was surprisingly good though.
author: Aj C.

description: Decent pizza but dont waste your time using Yelps Eat24 app to order. Its trash. Delivery guy forgot my drinks then when trying to get it taken off the bill the restuarant cant you have to contact eat24. Guess how easy that is  it's not at all. Plus you cant re access past orders to even deal with it. Trash at. Ubereats blows this thing away.
author: Bradley K.

description: Rudest delivery driver ever. First, he was late. Second, he called 5 minutes before he arrived but lied and said he was in front of my apartment so that I would come wait outside in the cold for him to get there. When I confronted him about this he refused to give me my pizza and complained that he was delivering for 5 hours. Excuse me, but that is 5 hours he was getting paid and receiving tips. I have no sympathy. If you don't like your job get another one. When I pay for a pizza and tip you 20% I shouldn't be lied to so that my delivery is more convenient for the driver.
author: danielle m.

description: Our slice had definitely been sitting for a while, flavor was mediocre and staff were not inviting. Seems to be a great spot for teens on their way home from school.
author: Elizabeth T.

description:
This is my favorite pizza spot. I always place large orders and they are consistently good and no issues with delivery to work. Perfect ordering pizzas whenever we have office parties or gatherings. 

We always order: Verde, Coit Tower, and North Beach. SO GOOD!!!!
author: Jennifer J.

description: Driver shows up an hour BEFORE the scheduled time. Had to put the order in our fridge which ruined our meals.My order was wrong, no one took the time to read the note I had included with the order. And, they forgot to include the salad that was supposed to come with my meal. More frustration. An hour later, they finally delivered another order of my food. Not a good experience; won't be ordering from them again.
author: Carolyn M.

description: This is the worst North Beach pizza in the city. BY ALL MEANS go to the other locations. This place will mess your pizza up. It's borderline inedible. (the one on grant is the way go go!!!)
author: Amit D.

description:
I will never ever spend another dime here they lost an very loyal customer ordered my pizza the delivery lady was just plane disrespectful and rude I give her my money for my food she hands me my pizza and starts to walk away so I ask her if can have my Chang from my order she said really I replied yes she throughs the money at me and walks off I get inside and open my pizza all of my toppings have slid to one side so I call back they send me another pizza no problem till the rude lady walks up again and throughs 11 cent at me and shouts here then she pushed the pizza into my chest already irritated angry and hungry I still try to eat my pizza but now the bottom of my pizza is soggy because it's sitting in water.....

By far the worst delivery experience ever
author: Dee I.

description: This review is for delivery only.  When I get delivery at home in the Richmond District from the Stanyan location, the pizza is hit or miss.  But this week I ordered 5 pizzas from the Grant Street location for an office lunch (in North Beach) and the pizza was great, so if you're close to the store your chances for excellent pizza are better.
author: Julie B.

description: North beach pizza is the best pizza place in terms of taste and service. We had a pizza delivered quickly and it was hot like it just came out of the oven. Delivery guy was friendly. I would definitely be back and recommend this place to anyone. Thanks !!!!
author: Sagar V.

description: My husband and I took an uber to North beach pizza from our hotel while visiting San Francisco for the weekend. It's was around 830 at night, we were looking forward to sharing a pizza and some beers but when we got here we realized this isn't an actual restaurant. The few stools and small counter is only for employees to use. It was disappointing for sure, but we still ordered pizza, eggplant parmesan and a Greek salad. The service was friendly and helpful. We got in an uber back to the hotel once our food was ready. Our garlic chicken pizza with Alfredo sauce was ok, nothing special. Greek salad was ok as well, kalamata olives had pitts in them still and the small plastic container was over filled making it hard to get the lettuce buried under everything else, why not put it in a bigger container??? Eggplant parmesan was also ok. Next time we're in San Francisco and craving pizza we'll go somewhere else.
author: Nina L.

description: Best pizza in regards to taste and delivery was prompt!! Their entree options are good as well!! We had a cable car pizza medium!!! Delivery person was polite!!!!!!
author: Ramu N.

description: The pizza was tasty. It was hot, just like if I had been at the restaurant, sitting table side. It was just a tasty pizza. I will definitely order from North Beach Pizza again, and again.
author: Carmen O.

description:
I used to eat their pizza all the time when I lived on this side of town. Still pretty good thicker crust pizza with nice toppings. It ain't cheap but they do not skimp on the toppings. My only gripe was the pieces of bell pepper were put under the cheese and were too large...sorta made the crust a little too moist.

Still if you are going to kezar for high school pigskin or hoops check it out.
author: David G.

description: I placed an order.. They waited 45 min to call me and tell me they don't deliver in my area.. I'm just 4.5 miles away.. They should of at least have the courtesy to deliver my pizza.. Why wait 45 minutes?
author: Juliana V.

description:
I was referred to this pizza place by my roommate, and I never gave it a try until couple of  weeks ago.

I ordered pizza for an office event -- and that was the first time that my food was not enough (everybody loved it).

The girl with the accent on the phone was super nice and sweet too. I loved making business with her.

My favorite was the Hawaiian pizza, but the pepperoni slice was impressive as well. Just a nice balanced crust cooked in a seasoned oven.  Great cheeses and meats on top. This is my favorite pizza place in town -- and they definitely deserve 5 stars. I will place our second order soon.
author: Allan S.

description: Let me start off by saying I loved this place until recently. I called over there to order a simple large pizza. I was put on hold for five minutes while the lady answering yelled at her coworker in a foreign language. Was then helped and put our order in. 70 minutes goes by and we finally called over to check where the driver was. The same angry lady answered but instead of saying "hello" was yelling at the same coworker in the background. Super weird. Hung up an called back. Same lady finally greeted normal. Asked where our pie was since it was past the delivery window and she said he was just about to leave?!? Um what?!? It's now been 90 minutes and we are still waiting. And it's after the lunch rush. No idea whats been going on here but please hire new staff. So annoying and unprofessional.
author: Bri R.

description:
The two star review. 

I don't do this often, but one star is for the fact that the delivered mostly the right order to my place.

We've been ordering here for years as the local, go to for reasonably priced Italian. 

Lately the food quality has been going down hill fast.  I'm not sure if there has been a change in owners, or the kitchen, but I would like to highlight one of their worst moments yet: the Fried Calamari.   Yes, it's delivery,  so I'm not expecting the moon and stars, but what was delivered to us was actually inedible.   It was so dry it was almost like eating a calamari potato chip that tasted as thought it was fried in old, dirty oil.  I asked for marinara on the side and instead got two pathetic packs of tartar sauce. 

Our go to Chicken Parm and Chicken Alfredo also soupy, lacking in flavor, freshness and texture. 

I think that was one two many strikes, North Beach.
author: Holly W.

description:
Quick stop for pizza if a crave starts up. Right next to Golden Gate Park. 
Food is always hot and worth my stop.
author: Corie L.

description:
I went here for a slice and it was just not good. I mean, my survival instinct didn't compel me to spit it out upon immediate contact with my taste buds or anything - but it was just not tasty.

Escape from new york is also just a couple blocks away and so so much better.... And I get north beach isn't supposed to be "New York style pizza" but just the general taste and quality is still way worse than escape from New York... And just not good in general. Maybe their whole pies redeem them? Never had one. But their slices are certainly don't satisfy.

Also, it's definitely more of a delivery joint - there's barely any room inside so if you get a slice expect to eat it on the bench outside whilst fighting off high schoolers or be super cramped and get very up close and personal with the staff..., there was like one stool in total bc it's so small. It was an awkward and uncomfortable experience since I was the only customer.

Just not a good experience. Usually it's hard to screw up pizza... But I would straight up rather have eaten a salad. A. SALAD. That's devastating. Go somewhere else or eat an effing salad and cry.
author: M H.

description: This is definitely the best pizza I ever had!.  From the fresh ingredients to the delicious  crust, just the right amount of  flavorful sauce and cheese. I will definitely be back for the great food and  friendly service.
author: Denise C.

description: The pizza tastes good but the price is out of control.  I paid $34 for a large 4 topping pizza, delivered.  I didn't quite catch the full price on the phone and was quite surprised when the driver arrived with the bill.
author: Ryan P.

description:
Not all pizzas are created equal.

This place is a testament to that statement. Although boasting awards about their pizza, this joint has not proven its award-winning taste to me. In fact, I think their pizzas are a long way from that. 

I walked in to order a slice of pesto pizza and a cup of water. Because they had no water, I ended up ordering a sprite instead. (Total cost: $5; paid by card)

First of all, who doesn''t have plain, non-sparkling water? So instead, I opted for a sprite, which was lukewarm after removing it from the fridge. That definitely puzzled me because coming out warm defeats the purpose of putting it into a fridge in the first place. I figured this may be because the fridge wasn't operating properly. Regardless, that was not acceptable. When I opened the can and took a sip, I realized I forgot to wipe the lid, which tasted contaminated. By then, I lost my appetite, fearing I consumed a pathogenic bacteria. Needless to say, my opinion of this place was not starting off on a good note. 

Then, I tried the pesto pizza, which seemed as if it was sitting in the rotating glass case for far too long. It didn't taste fresh & the ingredients tasted poor quality for $3.50/slice. The crust tasted stale & I didn't like how it wasn't heated before it was served to me in a small, white pizza box that was stained with grease when I lifted the pizza to try it. I think, despite the distance, you're better off driving to Cheeseboard in Berkeley to get a better tasting pizza for a cheaper price (plus, if you're lucky, free entertainment). Regardless, I was disappointed by the taste of the pizza & should have read through reviews prior to trusting my gut & walking into this place. Nevertheless, I formed my own opinion and would not recommend coming here. Neither do I plan on returning for a future visit just because of the poor quality of the pizza.
author: Brittany D.

description: Had a slice of mushroom pizza for $3.50..and I thought "Wow, this slice of pizza is really good!" Good sturdy crust and cheese and tomato sauce mix was perfect.
author: Denise C.

description: Loved the San Francisco pizza with garlic and clam ... crust done just right. Service was quick and friendly . Very interesting decor.
author: Carl K.

description:
Eh. One time we set the delivery time for 1 o'clock...it came two hours early. My coworker marked the box and asked for a fresh pizza to be delivered at the time we specified..1 o'clock rolls around and back comes the pizza WITH THE SAME MARK ON THE BOX. REALLY?! That's just laziness. 

Secondly, I work in a big office, when a certain group of people order they will actually highlight and circle the tipping instructions. Mind you those people ALWAYS tip, I guess just not enough according to their standards? Rude.

Lastly, reception is not allowed to tip, unless instructed to do so before the delivery arrives. If reception cannot get ahold of who ordered the food, they are instructed to sign, and take the food. The person who the food is for will call back and add a tip if they wish. I guess as of late the delivery people don't like that idea, and will actually leave with the food. When the customers read the email from reception saying their food is here for a CLIENT MEETING, and come downstairs to see nothing, it is a horrible experience, and makes everyone involved very angry. You shouldn't have to see the card or the card holder if there has been an account already set up for years.

One of our agencies has already canceled their account with them for these two reasons. And I personally, will not order from here again because i'm scared of what the obvious disgruntled employees could potentially do to my food.
author: Katie B.

description:
I have been going to North Beach Pizza on and off for years but not for some time.
My wife and I were driving home and decided to get something here to take home.
The Eat 24 app said it would be a 10-30 minute wait.
I stayed in my car for 20 minutes and went in only to be told you are here so soon. Excuse me!
I am writing this review while I am still waiting for my order 45 minutes later.
This place h
as gone downhill to the MAX! I will never come back.
My suggestion to everyone is if you really need to eat here order your food at least 24 hours ahead of time so it will be ready when you want to eat it.
I only hope that the food isn't as bad as the service has become.
Next time We are in the neighborhood we will just go to the McDonald's down the street like my wife told me to do in the first place.
author: Harry M.

description:
Their gluten free crust is pretty good, and delivery is surprisingly fast.

But before you order, know their website prices are not updated (significantly), and they don't honor them. I recommend calling on the phone to get your actual prices and not order online. 

I can roll with the surprise (when not unreasonable), and I sympathize with the plight of a restaurant owner, so I don't want to underpay. However, their attitude about it is surprisingly harsh. 

The person I talked with didn't want to tell me what the updated prices per item were, just the lump sum difference I was being asked to pay. Since it was actually an excessive amount, and having been refused the updated prices, I asked to skip the toppings and just get plain cheese pizzas. 

They showed up with toppings, and a request for more money.

I am seriously reluctant to order from there again, and am disappointed that I have to look for another gluten-free pizza delivery place (the GF pizza at Extreme gives me a stomach ache).

Bottom line: in a pinch, their GF crust is good, and delivery fast. Just know what you might be getting yourself into otherwise!
author: LD M.

description: I just received a pizza delivery late. It was COLD.  The pizza was room temperature and the cheese wasn't melted anymore.  It's so solid and congealed that when I tried to lift one slice, the cheese pulled off the bread and stuck to the rest of the pie.  So mad!
author: Needles K.

description:
Walked in hoping to grab a quick slice of pizza. Saw 3 people working and said "Hello" twice and not one acknowledgement. 

Stood around too long for late night greasy and under heating light pizza.
author: Michael D.

description:
Tried North Beach On Stanyan again. They let me down again. I live four blocks away. After an hour we called to find out where they were. The guy claimed he could not find the address. Instead of getting out of his car and figuring out where our address was, he got within a block of our house,sat in his car  and honked his horn repeatedly. My wife looked out and he was houses away. I have told them I do not answer my phone from  numbers I do not know at night. All he had to do is look at the house numbers.

FOOD IS GREAT, BUT IS IT WORTH THE HASSLE.  This is the third delivery fail for them.
author: David M.

description: Ordered online via yelp at 8..walked over my Hawaiian with mushroom was piping hot waiting for me.  Guys were super nice!!  2nd time and still like the pizza with the crunchy outside and chewy in yum!!
author: Sandra S.

description:
I worked in the service industry for 10+years.   Stuff happens...I get it.   But if you're going to tell a customer your food will be ready in 45-60 min, you should at least call them to let them know it's on its way.

I waited over 90 minutes for the cold pizza.   If I wanted to put a pizza in the oven I'd make my own.

Unfortunately this wasn't the first time this has happened to me when I've ordered from them, but it's certainly the last.   There are too many other options in this city to be let down consistently.
author: Adam H.

description: As a New Yorker I am pretty particular about my pizza.  Every time I visit San Francisco I need a "North Beach" fix.  Their pizza is always hot, toppings are super fresh and the sausage is unreal!  Fuggggetaboutit!
author: Eduardo J.

description:
Hmm, what can I say? 
It's really close to my house. I never eat North Beach Pizza anymore. No great shakes. Sorry. 

North Beach Pizza was amazing like twenty five years ago; one in North Beach. Sadly as they grew citywide it went downhill or maybe my taste has changed a lot. An acquired taste?
author: Rachel D.

description: I am a very patient person, which is why I ordered from North Beach Pizza several times even after they were consistently 30 mins late but I'm done. The last order was 50 mins late, I needed to call the restaurant 3 times to get an update on the status of my delivery and there was no attempt of an apology. To top it off, they messed up my order! Done. TERRIBLE SERVICE.
author: Chris C.

description:
Too tired to go out, I let my friends from LA choose where we got our food from, and they chose this place.

We all had one of the pasta dishes, along with the gnocchi.

All were overcooked, bordering on tasteless. Salt helped. 

Only got 3 of the additional priced salads even though we paid for 4. Meh.

One and done.
author: William M.

description:
still the best pizza in sf but their staff lack any customer service skills.  I had problems ordering on-line, I am not sure when they switched to Ea24, but the order would not process.
I called to see if my order had been placed and the gentleman who answered the phone was annoyed that I was bothering him, caring to understand my situation with the on-line order.  

My pizza arrived like it had been juggled.  Not a clean pie but slices thrown all to one side.  Clearly, no on cares
author: Anthony B.

description:
Grab a slice to go, it's the only way!

POSITIVES:
+ Hubs and I loved the taste of their pizza!  I had a slice of the classic pepperoni pizza and he had two slices of the cheese pizza.  It's a delicious, simple, classic `pizza joint.  None of this fancy, gourmet prosciutto and arugula, flat crust kinda place.  Have it with a cold coke, YUM!  We were in SF for less than a week and we ate 3 of our meals here!
+ Its reasonable priced, $3.50 a slice.  I dont know why people are complaining that its expensive...have you seen pizza prices lately?  If you're not making it out of scratch at home, a whole medium pizza can run you 20-30 bucks nationwide unless you're at costco.  

NEGATIVES:
- Don't go here if you want to sit down and eat at a table, they have two benches situated outside (without tables) or you can eat while standing in a very skinny aisle in shop.  Hubs and I didn't mind because we wanted to just grab a slice, eat, and get on our way.  
-Bullet hole in the glass!  It's just a little scary standing there eating your pizza and seeing a bullet hole right by your head. lol.
author: Julia H.

description: Bought the yelp coupon and they wouldn't let me use it for a delivery order despite a lack of disclaimer.  Not a good way to run business for mediocre product.  I expect a refund from Yelp.
author: Phil G.

description:
Unexpected broil.

An unexpectedly warm January day. Do wish for some rain.

An unexpectedly large broiled chicken sandwich. Do wish less oil was used.

Pizza sauce, tomatoes and (guilty pleasure) shredded lettuce completed the $10 creation. Proved to be quite good but at a rather high cost. 

Just like this weather is coming with a high cost too: http://www.huffingtonpost.com/mark-morford/fine-weather-for-creepy-m_b_4640854.html
author: Jason B.

description: Ordered two large boxes of pizza and ask them to come by at 11:30am and guess what, they showed up on time and brought it steaming hot. I will give them four stars because the pizza here taste like it came from ol'Italian oven. Which, thats what I think it taste like. #4's
author: Anonymous I.

description:
Don't bother....just don't

We ordered at 6:30, Pizza arrived a little before 8pm 

The "Thin" crust was anything but thin, and because it had probably already been around the whole delivery area, it was lukewarm (at best) and the sauce had gone into the crust so it was pretty soggy. 

Never again
author: Jonathan S.

description:
Got it delivered. Came within an hour. I picked spinach, tomatoes and feta for the toppings and it was pretty delicious. I also got some steamed veggies and they were fresh and good, as well.

I got the "Pizza Salad" though, which sounds awesome in theory, but it was mostly a bunch of pepperoni and lettuce. Some good olives, but meh. Also not good with ranch.
author: Sam D.

description: Terrible terrible terrible. Worst delivery service. I was sending pizza to a friend who was having a terrible day and the delivery man was yelling at me for not meeting them outside. They didn't even try the doorbell or calling first. Immediately got yelled at for not being there and complaining about the other deliveries they had.
author: Ashley L.

description:
The pizza is 4-star against my ever changing palate. 

Then there is the reason I bothered to write any review.

My first customer service experience was not great because a staff member made my visit gut wrenchingly miserable. They are however responsive and genuine in their desire to satisfy an upset customer. And I don't mean free pizza, I mean taking action to address the issue. That is refreshing.
author: Marc R.

description:
I live in the outer Richmond. Everything except Gaspares on Geary is awful.
I ordered GG from Stanyan..they delivery hot fresh very good better then anything
In my area. Gaspares doesn't delivery, so this will be my delivery place. The delivery
and pizza is good from the Taraval location when I'm in that area at my friends.
author: Michelle L.

description: Ok I never do these things but I'm babysitting and ordered dinner for kids and myself and the driver forgot the drinks...when I asked him about it and showed that I was charged for theme just shrugged and said "sorry I guess you don't have to tip me..." What?!? Ugh.
author: Kia K.

description:
I am going to keep it short. If you had a bunch of drinks and want pizza then it may get the job done. Also a good location. But as far as the pizza pie we ordered: we diddnt finish it.

Also - Add garlic knots to the menu, its pretty much mandatory for any pizza joint.
author: Mike S.

description:
Some of the worst pizza I've had in San Francisco.

We walked by and decided to try a slice, even though my spidey-sense was tingling after seeing the dreaded pizza warming turntable (always a bad omen).

Thick, chewy, almost-raw dough. A layer of thick, bland mozzarella. Uninspired and lifeless sauce. Overcooked towards the tip of the slice (middle of the pie) and undercooked near the crust.

Avoid.
author: Menotti M.

description:
I really struggled with how to review North Beach Pizza. They are friendly and usually pretty fast. We order delivery pizza from time to time from them and it's pretty good - tasty sauce, but always too much cheese (which I almost hate to say, because I'm a big cheese fan). The crust is chewy which if I'm in the mood for is great. 

We've ordered eggplant parm sammies from them and Greek salads - both yummy. 

But yesterday we ordered wings for the Superbowl and they were just not good at all. Not crisp! And we even picked up the order so that they wouldn't sit in the delivery car. I broiled them for a few minutes which did the trick with the crispies, but the meat was quite fatty and the sauce lacking a bit. It was s little sad. 

We'll stick with the pizza, salad and sammies and leave the wings to other spots.
author: Mac M.

description:
Unplanned pit stops are the best. It was Sunday night and my husband and two sisters were in the car. "Oooh that's North Beach. Should we stop for pizza?" he asked them. After a resounding HELL YES, I busted a "u-ee" on Stanyan and parked in front of North Beach. It's a teeny little take-out only spot where you can also get pizza by the slice - perfection! We were hungry and didn't feel like waiting. We made our selections, gabbed sodas from the nearby fridge, and ate in the car. The slices were big and thick with cheese and toppings. I also liked that the crust was soft so you didn't have to gnaw your way through it like a dog through a chew toy. 

Thanks, North Beach Pizza, for the perfect end to my hubby and sister's birthday.
author: Mariela D.

description: Meh, not that great. Ordered delivery with the fam about 2 miles away and pizza was cold and not good. Would recommend throwing it in the oven at home when you get it.
author: Caitlin M.

description: Gross, microwaved food. Not worth a penny so never ordering again. Don't get delivery
author: Abby Z.

description: Horrible! I never write reviews but this place deserves it. $50 for buffalo wings, a Greek salad and cheese pizza. Thought at least one would be edible. 3 out of 3 sucked.
author: Courtney M.

description:
These guys are fantastic.  I ordered lunch for 75 construction workers and was a little nervous about the size of the order (40 pizzas!).  The pizzas were all hot when the delivery guy arrived (exactly on time) and everyone loved them.

Thanks very much.
author: Valerie A.

description: Dare I say it?  This is now my go-to spot for a slice.  Escape is good too, but now that I know I can get a slice here - I'll walk the extra block.
author: Ross H.

description:
I remember, as a kid growing up nearby, how North Beach Pizza used to be my pizza world.  And as my tastes grew finer with sophistication and class, I no longer needed mounds of cheese on dough and the spicy aftertaste of medium-grade pepperoni and sausage.  So my dedication waned...

Tonight, this Thanksgiving Eve and stressful work day, I ventured to North Beach after many,many years of an absence. 

And it can be a whole 'nother many, many years before I return again.

Two simple requests: 1. thin crust; 2. parmesan and peppers to augment what I remembered to be an overpowering blandness of mozzarella.  What did I get?  Only the first.  Why?  THEN I remembered that North Beach seemed to always have this issue.  So, while the pizza wasn't all that awful, peppers would have been lovely.

Here's one thing that I'm happy about though - North Beach has joined the Seamless revolution.  So, I can order and not have to deal with a single person over there on Stanyan. Part of the reason why I stopped ordering from them (other than there being better options, I soon learned) is that they just weren't very easy to get along with.  Their customer service sucked major cahones.

I don't eat pizza very often.  Let's just say that North Beach doesn't necessarily give me reason to change that frequency.
author: Tamar D.

description: I'm vegan so I had a small vegetarian pizza delivered, sans cheese. The person I talked to on the phone was helpful in determining if the dough was vegan. I always appreciate when people go out of their way to figure out the ingredients. The pizza is a little overpriced but it was really good & they were generous with the toppings. The delivery guy was friendly & the pizza was just as good cold for breakfast the next morning (the true test of good pizza)!
author: Jess H.

description:
I appear to be in the minority here, but I must qualify my review with the following:

1) Order the pizza to pick up, and it'll be ready in 15 minutes. Order for delivery, and you have a crapshoot. They deliver by driving around the city, and you cannot guarantee that your pizza will be the first out of the trunk.
2) Order the pizza with pesto sauce. Do not pass go. Do not collect $200. Just do it.
3) Order the pizza. Period. This is a pizza joint, people, and that's what you should realistically expect them to make well. Period.

The pesto pizza is perfect. Period. Finito. Let's move on.

Or not.

The sauce is really garlicky and flavorful, and the pizza was piping hot when I arrived to pick it up at this location. Not being a fan of tomato sauce to begin with, I was thrilled to see they offered this green and garlicky option. The toppings were plentiful, and they must use some special dough for the crust because it actually tasted like bread - special bread, that is. You know, like it was ciabatta or something.

The pizza itself is a tad pricey, and the toppings can add up if you get the pesto sauce and a couple additional toppings. However, to me it's totally worth it, and also note that inside the shop they have flyers, which have coupons for $1 off a small, $2 off a medium, and $3 off a large.

Anyway, five stars for both this and Eleven Madison Park? "Blasphemy! What could they possibly have in common?" you may ask. They're good at what they do, and in this case, what North Beach Pizza does is pizza.
author: Audrey J.

description: I had the pleasure of stoping by the place with my girlfriend after we had a walk in golden gate park about a month ago. This is by far the best pizza place in SF and we still swing by every time we're in the area. The only drawback is that they don't have seating available but in a way its nice to walk around eating a warm fresh slice while the cold city air hits your face.
author: Simon D.

description:
I walk past this place on a daily basis.  Today I was enticed by the pizza by the slice.  I was hungry, on my way to class, and it was quick.  

$5.50 for a slice of sausage pizza and and a 20oz bottle of lemonade.  The lemonade was very tasty.  It came from a bottle so North Beach Pizza had nothing to do with the processing or taste of the lemonade.  The sausage pizza on the other hand was completely not edible.  

I believe that they purposely undercook some pizzas because they expect that they will be sitting under the heat lamps for some time.  What was served to me was garbage.  I walked outside and sit on the bench and had a drink of lemonade.  I planned on tearing into the slice of pizza and then heading to class.  I took a huge slice of doughy pizza which I immediately spit out while trying to avoid vomiting.  This slice of pizza was nothing that I expected.  

I've worked as a server in a restaurant now for 10 years.  I am a firm believer that if you clean a plate that you should have to pay for a plate.  You were given a mouth and if you have a problem you need to speak up, especially when it comes to food.  I've had all types of customers; the good, the bad, the pain in the ass, etc.  At the end of the day it's those customers that allow me to have a job, and I should go out of my way to please them.  

In turn I might be the easiest person to wait on.  I enjoy a variety of foods, and I've had dishes that I didn't quite care for.  Usually this happens when I'm trying something new and feeling adventurous and didn't ask for a detailed list of all the ingredients in a dish.  Restaurant and bar staff usually find me a pleasure to deal with.

Rather than toss my doughy pizza in the garbage and walk away never trying North Beach Pizza again, I walked back in to the counter where I received my pizza from and told the asian girl at the counter that this pizza had in fact been undercooked and was no good.  If no one brings to to the attension of the employees how can the problem be remedied?  

Since I had in fact had the last slice of sausage pizza I asked if I could exchange the slice I had for a mushroom pizza (which looked cooked fully).  Rather than just exchange the slice of pizza she wanted to argue with me that I took a bite out of the pizza.  I was tempted to go outside and fish up the spit out piece of pizza and directly place it in her hand.   She did however offer to toss the undercooked slice into the oven and I could wait for it to finish cooking.  Needless to say she totally missed the point of me stopping in for a quick already made slice of pizza (I simply did not have time to sit around and wait for this slice to finish cooking).  I honestly do not think that I should have to wait for pizza by the slice at all, it's one of those grab and go kinds of things.

Rather than staying and arguing and making a big grand scene, I handed her back the slice of pizza and told her, "Fine, i will give you the pizza back and just chose to not come back."   She seemed perfectly content with that as I walked out of the door.  So be it!   

Obviously this location has way too much money because they care absolutely nothing about the guest.  I believe that the slice of pizza that I took a bite out of cost me $3.50 out of pocket that I will never receive back.  That's a small price to pay for the lesson that I learned today about how North Beach takes care of their guest.  Who knows, had the pizza of actually been cooked and tasty I would've stopped in 3X a week for a slice and lemonade ($16.50 weekly X 52 weeks = $806 dollar a year that North Beach Pizza will not be collecting from me).  

Kudos counter girl on a job well done.
author: Daniel P.

description: This place is awful. Horrible food and even worse customer service! This so called "manager" responds to reviews on yelp to make her establishment seem classy but one response and nothing after that is trashy! Get it together. Escape from New York is right around the corner and so, so much better. What a shame.
author: Ryan L.

description:
Awhile back, I was okay with this mini-chain; I can't condone its existence anymore. I only wish I had checked Yelp before placing that last order -- a health rating of 65 would have locked me out.

We paid $60, including tip, for two large pizzas that were pretty awful. The vegan one was the awfulest. The sausage and cheese wasn't much better -- and it had sausage AND cheese.

I'll admit that it's hard to expect a lot from a vegan pizza -- but why is that? If a place charges $25 it should be able to deliver a flavorful pie without cheese. Anyway, as I said, the sausage pizza was merely one or two ticks better.
author: Mark D.

description: I live on Carl st not far away, so delivery is always fast. Pizza here isn't Bad. It's actually pretty tasty. It's not the best in San Francisco but it's consistent and satisfying. I'll order delivery again for fast service
author: Andrew V.

description: I'm rating this mostly as a place to grab a slice on the go. I love the pizza here but haven't tried anything else. The place itself is small and cramped so I usually get a (large) slice of sausage to go ($3.50). Service is usually fast and friendly. I come back here frequently for a snack on the go.
author: Kyle J.

description:
I used to order from North Beach Pizza when I lived in North Beach and was happy to find that there was one near where I moved (the Richmond) and delivered.  The pizza is solid, good pizza.  Can't complain.  a meat pizza generally makes anyone who is at my house happy.  I tried their wings for the first time the other night - they were actually pretty good.  Not overly spicy - I don't care for wings that taste like they've been bathing in tabasco sauce.  These had a good basic wing sauce.  

only downside is that the crust can get a little soggy and therefore doesn't really re-heat well.  So order an appropriately sized pizza for your group so you don't have leftovers.
author: Nedra D.

description: I ordered two slices of NY cheesecake delivered, yes I am that lazy. Then 90 minutes later arrives two hot, miniature slices of chocolate mousse cake which was terrible. I spent $14 for the worst dessert ever, not what I ordered! I called and was informed I would be refunded 1/2 the cost, which has yet to happen. How do you mess up such a simple order? Never again.
author: Shannon Z.

description:
I have been a long term customer of North Beach and love their pizza. However, the last time I ordered online and used my credit card, I never got my order. When I called I was told they had no order for me and asked me if I wanted to place an order at that point. No apologies. I was also told my credit card would not be charge because there was n record of my order. Well, my credit card was charged. Zonic Ordering is the third party web site that processes North Beach's online orders. North Beach's web site and any other site the uses Zonic should be avoided.

Okay an update.

They  made good on my credit card. But whoever answered the phone needs training in customer service.
author: Jeff T.

description:
Normally, I'd just go out to pick up at a pizza at Gaspare's (which is awesome besides the fact that they don't deliver) but on this particular night it was storming outside. I've ordered from different North Beach locations in the past and never had an issue. But as far as this location goes, it's lousy service. 

I ordered a pizza at 5:30pm. I called at 7pm because it still wasn't here and they told me it was still out for delivery. I put on the online order and told them when I called that my doorbell was broken and the driver would have to call me and I verified my phone number. I tried to call again at 7:45pm and after a several attempts with busy signals and no pick-ups was told that the driver had been outside for 20 minutes but no one answered. 

I  asked to talk to the manager  who told me that it was my fault because I gave them the wrong number. I went back to check my order and saw that I had given them the right one. Dude straight up lied to me. He told me it would be at least half an hour before they could get it to me but that it would be cold. I told him forget it and that I wanted a refund and he told me that I had to talk to the manager. I told him that I thought that he was the manager and he said that then I'd have to talk to the owner later in the week.

8:05pm and I'm stuck waiting on a cold pizza that I can't get refunded. It finally arrives at 8:30-3 hours later and the driver who is really nice apologized. At least someone apologized. :/

I realize that on a rainy Saturday no delivery place is going get there in the estimated time. But really North Beach on Stanyan, you suck. Next time I'll brave the rain and pick up my pizza at Gaspare's where they treat customers right.
author: Wendolyn A.

description:
I've visited North Beach's other locations and found similiar issues.  I recently ordered a thick crust pizza and when it was delievered it was still raw. I quickly contacted management and the issue was rectified.  I placed another a few days later (today) for a broiled chicken sandwich and it was a miserable sandwich.  The was small, and the chicken breast was flattened and cut to the thickness of the tomato - super thin.  The flavor was decent but for the cost, it was definitely not worth it.  

I will defintely take my money and hunger to another pizza spot down the street - Pasquale's.
author: Mykul U.

description:
I love North Beach Pizza.  I go to the one IN Northbeach once a week.  Pizza is great. Pasta is great.  Service is great.  I recently ordered delivery from this branch expecting the same experience.  I ordered at 5:35 and my order did not arrive until 6:50.  The pizza was almost cold and crust was soggy.  How disappointing.  

NBP is not cheap pizza like Domino's.  I expect much, much better.  

One more annoying thing -- delivery guy said that there was an accident on Lincoln - which was his excuse.  I looked on google for traffic report.  No red spots as far as I could see.
author: Malcolm Y.

description:
Poor customer service!
I've been ordering from this place for as long as they've been at this location. After last night I think I'm done. I ordered through the delivery.com app which I've often done.The pasta entree I wanted offered an upgrade for an extra $3.50 which included garlic bread and soup or a salad. Then they throw in a delivery charge(not cool but OK, the food's good) and the bill totals $19.84. The delivery guy shows me a bill for $23.76. OK, I explain my order while he gets on his phone to the manager. I SHOW HIM A COPY OF MY ORDER ON MY CELLPHONE!! Then I show him the upgrade option on HIS menu. The manager tells him to NOT deliver the food. Guess what? For $3.92 you lost a customer for life. How does that feel?
author: Suck It Y.

description: Well, you get what you pay for.  I got a $3 slice of cheese pizza.  They didn't bother heating it up like they always do at Irving's.  But hey, I was a couple of beers deep.  I was hungry and ready to kick off the night of drinking on Haight.  It did the job and I'm grateful for it, however It's just not good pizza.
author: Sam K.

description:
I try this pizza and it's bad... it was so different like the true italian pizza..
The tomato sauce was acid and the mozzarella so strange...
author: Francesca S.

description:
I've eaten here once a week for 18 years and haven't tired of this place. Whether you're watching the Niners on Sunday or Pro-Am across the street, there is no question North Beach delivers a quick, Buddha-belly satisfying meal. A fat slice of pizza for 3 bucks? I'm sold. The Coit Tower and the meat lasagna are my go-to's for my cheese fix. Word to the wise, prepare for a 2+ hour food coma if battling more than three slices.

Tips:
- I know you want to plunge your face into the pie, but give it a minute to settle. Otherwise, the cheese and toppings will slip off, you'll be left with tomato bread and a dog at your feet. 
- Shoot the breeze with a little World Cup knowledge and get some comps. 
- Walk or bus it. Parking is epic in the bad way.
author: Damond N.

description:
By far some of the grossest pizza I've spent my hard earned money on. While I remember getting decent pie here for years, after a short hiatus they seem to have sunk into something I would only eat out of desperation and then only have I had picked the inch think wad of cheese off the top. If you're into greasy tasteless pizza this place is for you, if not there are millions of other much better pizza places that deliver.

On a side note, i opted to pick mu pizza up the other day instead of getting it delivered, they're little store front is equally dirty and gross. That alone would make me want to never order from there again, regardless of taste. I honestly have no idea how these guys have multiple locations and are still in business.
author: Allyson S.

description:
Pizza by the slice is pretty rad.

Quick, warm, pesto pizza with a nice crust. Not too greasy or messy. The price makes more sense when you see how GIGANTIC the slice is. Service is quick, not much emotion, but it doesn't matter anyway. I wish they had more space, better decor, and more seating :/ 

Final score: 3.25
author: Idk A.

description:
Convenient because it's right by my apartment but that's about it. If you loveee your pizza with an inch of cheese and an inch of toppings, this is the place for you! Unless it's a Chicago style stuffed pizza, the toppings should be in balance with the crust. Here? Not so much. The sauce and the crust aren't even that great. 

They do pizza by the slice though which is nice even though the pizza is mediocre so high five NPB for that!!
author: Jammir G.

description:
OK pizza by San Francisco standards.  Have to give them an extra star for delivering further than a few of the other pizza joints that are actually closer than me. 

The pizza sauce tasted strange(cheap? bad recipe? both?) and the dough was very ordinary. I hoped the high price would get me a yummy pie, and was once again dissapointed. If I had to eat here I wouldnt be totally pissed, but I wont ever choose to come back

Does pizza suck in the whole bay area or just SF?
author: Nelson S.

description:
Today I went to the North Beach Pizza at Stanyan St. with a friend.  We ordered a Greek Salad and a slice of cheese.  We also bought a second slice of cheese pizza for a homeless person who so happened to walk in the establishment behind us.

The cost was $15 plus we left a tip.  While my friend had his hands full, he asked me to walk inside to get some extra salad dressing because it was a little dry.  I was shocked when they charged me 30 cents being that they knew it was for the salad we just bought!

After spending $15 plus a tip, I thought it was tacky to charge 30 cents for a little extra salad dressing.  That is not the way to treat a paying customer.

I did not want to argue with them over 30 cents.  I do not want to patronize a foolish and cheap business that charges customers extra for condiments.
.
author: Sparky W.

description:
So far this is my favorite pizza place in San Francisco. the marinara sauce is somehow a little sweet- and they deliver my half Hawaiian and half extra cheese to my door- and even deal with my ridiculously excitable, but lovably friendly, pooch.

Been getting the same pizza every time, though, so don't know how 5 star it is, but so far so good.
author: Vee B.

description:
I'm usually a positive person and I try my hardest to find the best qualities in all the restaurants I review, but damn! I really had to give this "North Beach Pizza locations a two thumbs down for service and satisfaction. 

I'm not sure if the guys here were having a bad day or what, but they left a bad impression with me, my family and my hungry APPETITE. 

I called in our order and right away the yelp stars started to diminish. The person taking my order was really rude and was trying to rush my order. (and IT WAS ONLY ONE SIMPLE  ORDER!) And what annoyed me the most was that this person was talking in a muffled and low tone of voice, like he was about to fall sleep! WTH!

Me: Hello, I would like to order a 'Large' mushroom and sausage pizza please.

NBP: how many toppings? 

Me: ??? mushroom and sausage...........two toppings!

NBP: whats your phone #, address and cross street?

Me: (information....)

NBP: can you repeat that again?


..so at this point I started to get frustrated with the guy, but then again I'm nice and he could of been having a bad day....

after minutes of repeating the same information, he then gives me the  total, tells me it'll be 45 MINUTES and hangs up, without a bye! 

I ordered a LARGE MUSHROOM AND SAUSAGE PIZZA. My food complaint was that there were hardly any mushrooms. =(

oh well.......NEXT time I'll take my brothers advise and order from the 'NORTH BEACH PIZZA on 3054 TARAVAL ST / OUTER SUNSET. The people there are a lot nicer! lol
author: Oliver D.

description: Canadian Bacon & Onions, it was good & delivery service was fine.
author: Ann C.

description:
Me and my roommate have ordered delivery from North Beach Pizza several times in the last few months. The pizza prices are decent and it has always been reasonably quick.

However, the food is borderline terrible. The pizza would be somewhat okay if it had a decent sauce. For some reason, their sauce is extremely sweet, like its made with sugar or something. It's strange. I suppose some people might like it, but it's so far from a pizza sauce that it doesn't work.

The pasta dishes can range from alright, to just plain awful. The Ravioli Verdi was undercooked, bland ravioli swimming in a pastel-green flavorless soup. I had to pour half of the strange liquid out before attempting to eat this puzzling entree. Oh, and it was $11.50 before tax.

I'm being generous with the 2 stars because the service has always been decent and quick, and if they changed their ingredients and/or cooking methods I would happily give them another try.
author: Chris G.

description:
Note that these two stars are for 1) the food. The pizza was garlic-y goodness and the cheese was delightful. 2) The delivery man was as nice as the Mario character that he resembled. So what warrants the lack of THREE WHOLE STARS? The monotone grump on the order end of the phone tempted me to hang up more than once, and if my stomach hadn't won the fight, I would have. 

I asked for a side of ranch as well, and that must have stayed with the grump cause it never made it here...
author: Andrew Christian C.

description:
hella fat slices.

popped in for a slice on a drizzly wednesday night. for $3.50 i received a fresh slice of pesto that tasted just like my hometown pizza joint back in Connecticut. 

It's rare to find decent 'za in san francisco and so north beach currently holds some solid stars in my book. we'll see how they do on delivery one of these rainy nights i'm feeling too lazy to get out of my warm and dry nest... To Be Continued.

way better than Nizario's.
author: Libra J.

description:
I had a pizza delivered from this location almost two years ago.  I just found the receipt.  I had a coupon.  I had a salad also.

I was expecting average pizza.  Then I ate the pizza.  WOW!  It was super delicious.  I eat a lot of pizza and I have my own preferences and not everyone agrees with them.  But yeah...it was superb.  Awesome pizza.  I'll have it again for sure.  I still remember how good it was.
author: Cynthia B.

description:
I didn't eat here but I just came across that "health score"...65/100..REALLY!!?? Moderate vermin infestation, impromptu reheating of food, insufficient running water? 

One question: HOW THE HE'LL IS THIS PLACE STILL IN BUSINESS!?
author: Rouz E.

description:
I visited this eatery several years ago.

Started the dinner with 1/2 Caesar salad for $3.95
The serving of watery greens was so small that a baby rabbit would have starved to death.

The main course: a "North Beach Special" pizza.
The crust was doughy.
The sauce was vile.
The sausage tasted like Jimmy Dean's.

This was the single worst pizza that I've had since having the misfortune of "dining" at Papa Potrero's.

Simply put,  this was absolute garbage.
You'd be better off eating out of a dumpster.
author: Kevin K.

description:
I like North Beach Pizza a lot for delivery.  I have never had the slices referenced in many of these reviews.
I love an extra cheesy pizza, but this place puts so much cheese on the pizza that you can get a cheese hangover.  I always order the verdi special--fresh spinach, pesto, onions and feta cheese no red sauce. 
It is a pretty greasy pizza, but the taste is pretty consistent.
author: Katharine A.

description: Real nice guys, good pizza, great prices. Better than Escape From New York but not quite as good as Big Slice.
author: Ramiro A.

description:
Do not order from here - they repeatedly messed up my order and repeatedly didnt even bother to show up.

the pizza is lame anyways
author: Jerome, Jerome T.

description:
Baaaaaad news.
-Delivered real darned late.
-Gnocchi not right.
-Pools of grease in sauce.
-Put anchovies on salad rather than on side (coworker has allergies).
-Other directions not followed.

Took 70 min (rather than 50) to deliver; delivery alone, from a mile away, took 30', it wasn't rush hour, and my office has parking.

Gnochi: texture not firm enough; orange pools of grease from meat sauce soaked 2 paper towels. Cheese on top both scant and hardened rather than melted.

Put the anchovies on the salad rather than on the side as requested; allergic coworker couldn't eat the salad.

Sent lots of napkins/cutlery when we'd specified not to.

Major suckage. Will not order again.
author: Cara H.

description:
Pizza is super tasty--We had the Coit Tower & Cable Car Specials.  The Coit Tower is good bc there's a lot of MEAT.  i liked how they put the Salami UNDER the cheese (it was like finding a surprise) and how it had big pieces of sausage on top.  Cable Car special was also good--loved the garlic sauce they used instead of regular tomato sauce.  We ordered original crust...which is pretty doughy and makes you full faster (and tastes really good dipped in ranch...YUM)

I called and asked how many people a medium pizza would fill and was told "two or three" so I ordered 2 medium pizzas for five girls...we had more than half a pizza left!  I'm not sure how big or manly I sounded when I called...but we shoulda gone with two smalls.  

Prices are a bit steep for pizza...but it sure is tasty!!
author: Cher B.

description:
Delivery
Pasta/entrees

I've ordered delivery about 10 times so far.  Never pizza, only the entree's and pasta dishes since my freak-ass partner doesn't like pizza. 

Delivery time can be longish -- 45 minutes to an hour.  But worth the wait -- delicious.  Possibly longer on peak days/time -- but there's a REASON they can't keep up.  Demand!  Because its GOOD.  I've always received decently accurate estimates for delivery time.

The food has always arrived neatly packaged and HOT!  I mean, answer the door with some pot holders.  And I'm not that close the the location I order from (Stanyan).  

Portions are large -- entrees and pasta dishes are good for 2, and come with bread.  The chicken parm is fantastic. 

I don't rate 5 stars lightly.  For delivery Italian dishes, this is as good as it gets.
author: Robb K.

description:
Note: as a native New Yorker (Queens) Im VERY biased towards slices. 

That being said, North Beach Pizza is an ok establishment. Quick but damn EXPENSIVE, $30 for a pie?

Ok so comments about the food. What makes a slice is the sauce. NBP has good sauce, definitely 3 stars worth. However, the crust is almost as important. Two thumbs way down for that. 

Get it together,  We're not even in North Beach.
author: Kenny H.

description: Had a pizza delivered from North Beach and was very disappointed.  Undercooked dough and the cheese was of questionable quality at best.  Conversely, I have had good experiences with their chicken parm sandwichs (hold the lettuce and tomato because it is just weird to serve a chicken parm sandwich with Lettuce and tomato.)
author: Colin F.

description:
I've probably had every kind of pizza they have. I live only a few blocks away, so I can order delivery when I'm lazy and they'll take it over for me real fast. They always say they'll bring it in about 45min, but I think this is before they read my address because they always show up in about 15. =]

Anyway, the pizza's great, portions are big, prices will be pricey but hey it's a recession we're going through. Definitely try it before counting it out.
author: Jeffrey Z.

description:
I always thought North Beach pizza was pretty good at most of the locations I've been to but when I was about to order a pickup order here, I decided to check out their Yelp Reviews.  Looks like they weren't too favorable.  But you know, I had my mind made up to give them a try again and it certainly was not a mistake.  

I've been having a lot of mediocre pizza in the last couple years here.  Something's always been a bit off, whether it's the sauce, the cheese, the toppings, the crust.  Something hasn't been right but I feel like North Beach is certainly above average on all of those.  Not sure if my 5 star rating is because I've had so much average pizza recently but all I can really say is when I'm craving some good pizza again, this will be one of the first places I return to...  'nuff said...
author: Mark W.

description: Decent pizza, excellent online ordering. Sauce could have a little more flavor, but it will certainly do in a pinch.
author: Nora S.

description: I am in love with their pesto pizza.  In love.  Their pizza has a robust fluffy crust.  I like it.  They also have pizza by the slice which is extremely convenient.  The only complaint I have is that their delivery was a little slow and when the pizza arrived it wasn't very hot even though I live 2 blocks away.  I would have picked it up myself but I was hosting a few friends.  I'd give them 5 stars for their pizza and 3 stars for their delivery for an average of 4 stars.
author: Ona B.

description: I ordered a delivery from the website it said 45 minutes and I actually live just two blocks from there. After an hour I called them to make sure and from their reaction I get that they forgot about it and they tell me that the guy will be at my house in 15 min. Right, after other 30 he finally showed up. The pizza was good. My only regret is that I payed the tip online with my order and I put 20%, if I only knew!!!! From now on no tipping until they get to my house so I can decide how much to give.
author: Simona F.

description:
If it weren't for the Verdi pizza (spinach, pesto, feta, artichoke and onion), the rating would be a bit lower. I find the crust to be very thick, and the toppings to be piled on just a bit too high for the most part. But, for whatever reason, their style of pizza works nicely with the Verdi, and the crust is easily spruced up the next day with a little olive oil and garlic powder. 

I appreciate the fact that pasta and a large variety of salads are available if you're not in the mood for pizza. I often get the baked carbonara, which is very heavy and filling, but will last me a couple of meals. Delivery is fairly reliable and runs until 3am. 

The prices are on the higher end, but coupons are readily available if you know where to look. Overall, a consistently good spot that panders to my occasional need for social hibernation.
author: Sus... B.

description: I don't understand why they get so many bad reviews!  I've never been to the location, but I pretty much exclusively order pizza from North Beach Pizza.  I find they are very consistent.  The pizza is delicious, everyone I've ever spoken to on the phone there is super nice, they get here fast, the drivers are always friendly and I recently discovered their very easy to use online ordering system.  I'm thoroughly satisfied with them.
author: Dara P.

description: Came here for pizza before a Summer League game at Kezar. Seems like this place has taken it's customers for granted. Cashier does not even greet you and just looks at you until you order. I know it is to keep the line moving, but a simple "hi" will literally take less than a second. The pizza is also served luke warm unless you happen to place your order when a fresh pie comes out. This place is lucky that Kezar is right across the street because I see no other reason to come here for their cold pizza and cold service. I don't think I will be back next time I'm in the area for another game at Kezar.
author: Tommy C.

description:
what a disappointment....
my pizza (made a little over a mile away) took over an hour to get to me, it was cold. 
the toppings were on some pieces but not all, and were, well, not what i'd hoped quantity wise. when a place charges $dollar of more for toppings, there should be ample amounts *when vegetables, most especially...

also, i ordered online and while there is no delivery fee for their somewhat overpriced too doughy pizza (i used to love them, what happened?!) there was a "misc. fee" i called to find out that it's for their employees health insurance. annoyed that this was not upfront and an added fee that i did not anticipate. 

last order from here for this girl.
author: Wendy X.

description: Delivery guy literally yelled into the phone that my order was here and then refused to hand over my damn pizza until I unfolded the cash and physically showed him it was all there. This took place in a hospital btw.
author: SeeWhatHappens W.

description:
To start, I think all of the pizza in NoCal sucks, so my reviews on pizza will always be skewed lower.  

However, North Beach pizza is on the "less sucky" side of the suck scale.  Key pros:

Ingredients/toppings are fresh
Cheese is good quality
I always complain about the pizza dough, but at least this was cooked all the way through.

I also had the minestrone, which was good, and the greek salad, also good.

My only complaint would be: why doesn't the greek salad come with greek dressing?  I ended up with creamy italian, the choice that seemed to make the most sense.  Bah!

Also, this pie is PRICY.  Look out as you add toppings, the price skyrockets.

Fast delivery: a big plus.
author: Jessica H.

description:
North Beach Pizza, I have seen your type before. 

You are super fun to hang out with when you finally show up but you are always 2 hours late.  You always have some lame ass excuse like traffic or late getting out of an event or someone didn't show up to work and you had to cover for them. I have heard it all before and you know what? Excuses only get you so far. 

I have given you lots of chances. I have called you from several locations in the city offering you alternate destinations and alternate routes. You still seem to show up late and a little cold when you should be warm and loving and there at the time you said. 

I mean, how hard is it to say you need two hours if you need two hours? Don't keep this woman waiting, especially without so much as a phone call, its just plain rude!  

To top it off you are never apologetic, you never make it up to me with a nice little gift (or discount) for keeping me waiting for 2, sometimes 3, hours. When I try to call you to talk to you about it you hang up on me. 

I guess if you invite me to your house I will go, because, as I said, once you are around I am happy but I'm certainly not making plans for you to meet me out anywhere anymore. You are just too unreliable.
author: Drue C.

description:
The guys at NBP have come through for me when I was in a bind many times.  The pies are good but the slices are often left under the heat lamp too long.  The upside of that is that you don't have to wait for them to reheat. 

They are quick and curt, but can be a little ogley (not at me), to the extent that I have seen them all trail out of the shop to watch a cute customer walk away.  Prices are decent for substantial slices and they are close to my apartment, open early and stay open late, so I love them.  I also dig the sausage they use, which says a lot, because I have never been a fan of sausage on pizza, but whatever they are laying out is tasty with hints of anise that works better than it sounds.  One of the better places to get a slice in the city.

Update 11.11.07:
Lately, the pies have been soggy and the staff has been surly.  I'll go back, because it only takes me 45 seconds to walk there, but things seem to be on the decline.
author: Quinn S.

description: The crust for this pizza was really really thick and filling...I wish that the crust was filled with something since it was heavy on the bread. Also, I tend to like thin crust pizza better. I ordered 2 of their most popular pizzas: North Beach and meat lover's. Was not really impressed with either of them. First, didn't think they tasted that good. Second, thought they should have put more toppings on...almost felt like a cheese pizza with a few sprinkled toppings to me.
author: Liwei Y.

description:
Reasons to get a slice:

-- You're waiting for the posse to arrive at the bar, and you want to hold off on bar-food until then
-- It's a gorgeous, warm day without a cloud in the sky, and a slice in the Park sounds just perfect, thanks
-- You like tasty pizza, served hot as a motha, with delicious toppings

Reasons not to get a slice:
-- You like customer service.  The people running the place are as rude as they come
-- You want to eat inside.  No room.
-- You don't like getting hassled by drug dealers.  This is the Haight, after all.
author: Jim C.

description:
At Kezar, not really feeling like wings, so we head up the street to North Beach Pizza.  I order one slice for $3, and its already heated for me ready for me to grub on.  No waiting for them to re-heat it.  The slice is thick with crust, which is my absolute favorite part, and the mushrooms are mixed in perfectly with the cheese, which is my second favorite part, and the sauce is there, but not glopping all over the place, which is my third and final favorite part, and I order it to-go, so i get a box, but i don't need it, because the next thing i know is my piece is gone, and I feel like a disgusting pig, but I'm full, content and satisfied, and wasted a box which is bad for the environment.  $3 well spent. (except the environment part)

Ive ordered deliver from here too.  Even makes me feel grosser cuz I always eat more than one.  But its self inflicted torture, so I cant knock North Beach for me being a glutton.
author: Lauren F.

description: Looks big from the outside easy to find. Inside there is just enough room to order a wonderful Pizza and go. By the slice is fast. I like the Verdi - Pesto, Pesto Sauce, Fresh Spinach, onions, feta cheese, NO red sauce.
author: Kristian M.

description:
Twin Peaks is a weird show.  It's especially weird when you're watching it in hallucination-inducing hunger because your pizza is over 45 minutes late (and drinking cherry-pie cocktails on an empty stomach--an homage to Agent Cooper, of course).  It's also full of anticlimaxes, not unlike when your pizza finally does arrive, only to be lukewarm, so you have to wait an additional 10 minutes while your oven reheats it.  Now, at this point, you've finally got yourself a damn fine pizza, and HOT!  And while it may look like a waifish thin-cruster, it's actually extremely dense (both cheese and crust).  But by this time you've gone as mad with hunger as Leland Palmer, and you've inhaled 4 slices like a little lamb eating so much ivy.   And if the show is weird on an empty stomach, that's nothing compared to watching it through the dream-haze of a pizza-induced semi-coma.  

In other words, dense, well-made, but it takes too long to get anywhere and the night inevitably ends with bizarre dreams.  Wait, am I talking about the show or the pizza now?  Maybe, in a Lynchian twist, the show IS the pizza...

Anyway, if they deliver it punctually next time, I'll totally bump this to 4 stars.  Although maybe I should be ordering from the Taraval location instead?  Note that Stanyan is the only North Beach that's delivery-only.

(Update 10/27/09: I tried these guys again now that I live about 4 times closer.  Still slow, and not as good as other options in the nabe).
author: Wes M.

description:
There's something to be said about a plain cheese pizza.  Basically that the toppings will not overload you and cause you to think that there's too much crap on your slice.  

Tonight we order 1/2 pepperoni and 1/2 mushrooms.  While I really appreciated the fact that they baked their topping under the cheese, it appears as though they had to put on extra cheese to cover the toppings.  It was too much cheese.  But it was such good cheese.
