The BF thought it was too much cheese.  But he's got a trouble tummy even if he doesn't realize it.  Just wait until tomorrow, I'll be listening to the complaints any minute now.  

The flavor of the mushrooms was good.  But I'm a purist (now) and I really really like my plain cheese slice.
author: Christina C.

description:
Best pizza delivery in the Cole Valley/Haight area. 

Unfortunately, that's not saying super much. So how do I wind up eating from here on a semi-regular basis? Because the following exchange usually results in a call to NB Pizza - 

Devon's Boyfriend: I'm hungry.
Devon: Me too.
DB: I don't wanna walk anywhere.
D: Me too. And I'm too lazy to cook anything.
DB: I have Cup O'Noodles and Powerbars, we can have those. 
D: Umm, riiiiiiiight.
DB: Or we can order North Beach. 

...and we do. Bonus points for online ordering and friendly delivery dudes. I'm a fan of their Golden Gate, Cable Car, and Barbary Coast specials. However, the pizza itself reminds me of upgraded Domino's. It's not thin crust pizza, but also not deep dish - just standard crust and quality ingredients. 

I'm not too keen on settling for less than great food, but sometimes when I'm hungry and lazy, less than great is alright.
author: Devon S.

description: Got delivery from here Monday.  They do half and half pizzas which i love!  We got the North beach and Golden Gate special.  I may be a pizza minimalist, but there were sooo many toppings on this pizza!  It was almost too overwhelming!  We also got the tortellini with pesto with was really good, but be prepared for a really rich creamy sauce.  I sometimes I like pesto a little lighter.  I normally get pizza from the location near downtown on Grant which I remember being better, but this one wasn't too bad.  Still a good option for pizza delivery.
author: Elena N.

description:
North beach pizza in San mateo is one of my favorite places for pizza so when i found out that i was going to live within ordering distance of one i leaped for joy...

I've ordered from them(stanyan) not once, not twice, not even thrice... but fourice!!

fool me fourice... shame on me indeed!
mind you when i was living in SM i only ordered the cable car special...

i've stuck by that pizza with the stanyan north beach as well ... it's really bad for the price

Service:
everytime, the pizza is cold and takes almost one and a half hours everytime to deliver. they've offered me discounts on my next order and do not agree to it when it comes time to own up...  one delivery guy was a douche, when i asked for parmesean/peppers(which he didn't provide) he said i had to ask for it when i called in, you're a pizza delivery guy for God's sake... that's like ordering sushi and having to ask for soysauce and wasabi.

crust
the crust is consistently inconsistent... either raw or burnt... you'd figure at some point and by pure statistics they would've gotten it right at least 2 times... nope

top
the toppings are always on one side of the pizza and never distributed across the pizza so one guy usually gets a kick ass piece and the rest are stuck with a cheese pizza with some sliced meat below.

SM and North beach pizza are good... stanyan we'll wait and see if they get better cuz i know they have it in em
author: Watty Y.

description:
Every time I have ordered North Beach, their service has been reliable but the pizza is very inconsistent. The pie itself suffers from too much toppings (cheese especially I think) that cause the bottom of the crust to get very soggy very quickly, if it doesn't already arrive soggy. I appreciate the attempt to put a lot of yummy stuff on top of the pizza, but the whole thing winds up mushy and impossible to eat with your hands- a fork and knife are usually necessary. I like the sausage they use and they tend to be generous with the garlic (which I love), but it's been so inconsistent that I really have stopped ordering from there. In general not a bad idea to stop eating delivery pizza... it helps the waistline. I'm kind of glad nothing around here is reliably good.

I have ordered a salad once or twice I think, but that really is pointless. It's not the place for salads and you can tell they are afterthoughts covered in pizza toppings.
author: Amanda C.

description:
So a co-woker and I ordered from here for delivery.  They were prompt and delivered within the 45 minutes they quoted on the phone.  Nice.

We ordered a med. half veggie half aloha pizza, garlic bread, and fetuccini with clams in white sauce, a side of ranch for dipping.  The fetuccini was OK...when I saw "white sauce" on the menu I was thinking white wine sauce, so I was a bit disappointed.  It was fetuccini alfredo with clams, ok but nothing spectacular.  

The pizza was fairly thick, which is nice cause they give you a lot of cheese and toppings, but the flip side of that (as mentioned in previous reviews) is it makes the crust a bit soggy in the middle.  Even the box was moist and left a moisture mark on the table when I lifted it.  Hmm...not so great.  As far as taste, I'd have to say it was just okay (bordering on the bland side)...not worth ordering again.  Granted I only ate a slice of the veggie...I couldn't take much more disappointment.

The garlic bread, on the other hand, was YUMMY...but how can you mess up garlic bread?!?!?!

One more thing, they forgot my side of ranch...which isn't a big thing but it might have salvaged my slice of pizza and added some flavor (since I sometimes like to dip my pizza).
author: Row M.

description:
My company orders from here from time to time during our lunch break.  

This time I had their Coit Tower and North Beach pizza.  Don't let their cleverly named pizzas fool you because these are just your normal pizzas.  The Coit Tower is basically peperoni and sausage.  

 I agree with Spatzle S. that the pizza is smothered in cheese, not in a good way.  But all in all, their pizzas are better than the "chain" pizza places.
author: Danny P.

description: Stopped in here because I was really hungry, and I always like trying new places.  After I was done with my two very mediocre slices of pizza I wished that I was hungry and adventurous less often.
author: Bill H.

description: Came home and didn't feel like cooking dinner, so I looked for a pizza delivery place and this one was the only one who didn't chage a $15 to 20 dollar minimum for delivery! Only 10...Pizza came exactly when they said, and nice and warm. It tasted great. Happy customer here :) Thank you!
author: Kristianne M.

description:
My friend told me there are places when you make an order, they will ask you whether you have a coupon or not. If you don't, then they will give you pizza with real cheese; otherwise you get the crappy cheese substitute. Well, the pizza here is just not that good regardless. The pizza is mounted with tasteless cheese(??) which I skinned off. Unfortunately the dough was very dense and didn't feel like it was baked through. So I threw that out also. At the end, I had nothing left to eat...

Don't be greedy with the garlic sauce, it's salty as hell!
author: Tingting H.

description:
We used to order from Mozzarella di buffala, but the location that delivered to us went under. I didn't really hold any particular allegiance to MDB, but the magnets were on the fridge when we moved in so we didn't even have to look up the number. Every time we ordered from MDB the pizza was burnt, late and cold. No wonder this particular location went under. 

North Beach Pizza saved us from pizza purgatory. Delivery is always faster than they quote, the pizza is hot, and 2 words "verde special". I know that everyone has a feta, pesto option on the menu, but I must say that NBP does it right. I usually cook, but on the days that I don't get home until late becuase work was terrible and I am starving, the fam is starving, and couldn't stand on my feet for another second, this place saves the day everytime. NBP is the perfect end to a long day.
author: Seth H.

description:
I'm not one to get pizza with chicken, but the Golden Gate Special is fantastic (chicken, pesto, mushrooms, garlic and onions).  It's super garlicky, so beware.  I usually get this pizza when I order delivery.  However, I recently was out with gals trying to avoid mass quantities of garlic, and we opted instead for the North Beach Special( pepperoni, green pepper,  sausage, mushrooms and onions).  Very good as well.  It's kind of a messy/sloppy pizza to eat, especially when you first open the box, because there's so much cheese and ingredients.  As you eat, the cheese cools and makes it much easier to just grab a slice and chow down. 

As far as pizza hierarchy and my rating goes, this is the best of the non-specialty non-fancy pizzas.  Of course, Little Star, Pizzeria Delfina, and A16 are in a whole other pizza class.
author: Angie C.

description: I was delivered a cold thin pizza called to inform them and the owner hung up in my face I called back asked to speak to him again he told me it was a accident how the hell is hanging up a accident when you slammed the damn phone down of course I went off and returned the favor will no longer order pizza frome here
author: Jovonda J.

description: Every pizza I've had here has been a winner. They make whole pies fast, with soft crust and good sauce. I get tomato and mushroom, light on the cheese. Mmmm.
author: Leo B.

description: Ordered a large Verdi Special and a Margarita and a large Caesar salad. Good all around. Fat crust, tons of cheese, just what the other review's promised. Ordered at the counter, went down to Kezar's Pub down the street for a cold one and came back 20 mins later to take the piping pies home.
author: Cliff M.

description:
You're standing on the corner of Stanyan and Haight at the end of a bar crawl. It's dark. You're drunk and hungry.

You are carrying: five dollars
Obvious exits: n, w, s

As far as post-bar food goes, your best options are Escape from NY Pizza to the west and North Beach Pizza to the south. (If you're thinking to yourself "What about the McDonalds right there?" you need to be slapped.) We looked at EfNY a week or so ago, so lets head over to North Beach Pizza.

North Beach Pizza has more of a traditional neighborhood pizza parlor feel to it than EfNY. There are no autographed photos of metallica on the walls, no punk rock blaring, no piercings or dyed hair behind the counter. The slices they offer tend to be on the traditional side as well; You won't find anything bolder than pesto here.

The North Beach pepperoni slice was a little thicker and more substantial than the EfNY slice. There are some things to keep in mind, however. Instead of throwing the slices back in the oven for a few minutes, they keep them in a warmer, which tends to dry them out after a while. Go with whatever looks freshest. There's standing room only and not much of it, and the inconveniently placed credit terminal makes this a great place to pay with cash if possible.
author: matthew r.

description:
With all the millions of Italian places to eat here in SF, one would think that management, and customer service would matter to someone in order to keep you as a customer.. clearly not to these guys. 

I ordered dinner tonight from these guys once again hoping that after the last time maybe they had gotten their shit together.. but things seem to have gone from bad to worse. 

Tonight was the same ole shit. First you wait an hour for your entree, then the delivery guy comes to your door, does not say hello, or how are you tonight, hands you cold food, fumbles around saying he has no record of your salad that you ordered, calls his boss, who btw really needs to be fired, and sent back to Brazil.. and then stands there with big eyes watching you sign the check seeing how much of a tip you are giving him for the beyond crap service you just got.  I learned my lesson tonight finally. The definition of insanity is doing the same thing over and over , and expecting different results. 

Lesson learned.. go somewhere else.. and save your mind.. and wallet.
author: Brian W.

description:
I've never ordered to-go from North Beach Pizza, probably because they don't deliver all the way down in SJ. However, I do make it a regular stop on my trips to Haight Street. I used to frequent Haight Street a lot during the days of Frequency 8 and when CyberTrance was HUGE in the Bay Area. At one point in time, I was here at least 2 times a week. 

Anyways, North Beach Pizza was a good pit stop for me and my fellow Record Diggin' partner. Pizza-by-the-Slice was always good. They warm up the slice in the over for you and you can eat it right there in the store. Yummy, greasy goodness!
author: Eladio S.

description:
The thing I love about North Beach Pizza is their pizza sauce...yummm. 
Their pizza is pretty good, however, I still prefer Cybelles or Seniores though (maybe because the slices seem bigger and theres more meat on them).
The ravioli appetizer dish is also pretty tasty. The ravioli is sort of breaded and roasted and comes with a side of marinara sauce for flavor.
The pasta here is also not too bad. I definitely would recommend the spaghetti marinara!
author: Miss H K.

description:
I never knew how good North beach Pizza could be until I had a late dinner at my boy place. We had been out watching NBA games at local bars and getting our drink on. We go back to his place and the family is there and right on cue everyone yells North Beach as we walk in the door. 

This had to be some of the best delivery pizza I ever had. We had two pizzas one with chicken and mushroom and deep dish chicken with tracks of  pesto.  Oh my it was so good. I will have to say it was the second best deep dish pizza I've had since the last time I was in Chicago.  The crust we nice and crispy and the dough was cook all the was through so it wasn't gummy like. 

I'm not sure if they are a 30mins or less place but we got the pizza pie pretty fast
author: Karim R.

description: Don't order from Stanyan St. location! Placed my order for delivery. Fried calamari had the texture of reconstituted rawhide chews. Looks like it had been microwaved. No marinara sauce, just 2 lemon slices. Lasagna the size of a frozen single serve french bread pizza costs $11.95.  It was centered in the tray and the height of the lasagna was half the height of the tray, if that. Sauteed calamari entree including spaghetti and veggies lacked flavor. On the plus side the chicken wings were delicious. All locations are separately owned. ORDER from the North Beach or Excelsior locations.
author: E R.

description: Such a good slice. Best slice in the Haight, Castro, & Sunset.
author: Ashlee M.

description: So the pizza by the slice was sub-par, but they had excellent thin crust Gluten-Free pizza. Who would have guessed that! And their salad was fresh and delicious!
author: M F.

description:
Oh my GOD!  The WORST customer service EVER! 

The guy on the phone was such an a**hole.  After ordering $55 worth of food, my ceasar salad comes with my pizza and it doesn't have dressing!  I was a little upset, but I figured when I called they'd credit me a free salad and send some one over with some dressing.  NOPE!  I call, and they say that I can wait 30 minutes for the dressing or be credited .50 CENTS!!!!  WHAT?!  Um, hell no!  So I say, that's not good enough.  They offer me a $5 credit OR the dressing.  Not both.  What the fuck?  I talk to the manager guy who was an a**hole and very unhelpful.  I said this was the worst customer service ever and he said, "well..." what the hell does that mean?!  So he finally sends over a new salad 15 mintues later and ASKS FOR OTHER ONE BACK!!  Are you f***ing kidding me??????  

I used to love ordering for NBP and have been a customer for years, but I will never order from them again.  They treat their customers like crap and honestly, the food isn't worth the price you pay.  Good luck with NBP.
author: Pixie D.

description:
Run of the Mill.
They deliver that is a plus.

can't say anything that I love or hate.

greasy cheese when you need it delivered to your tepee
author: Guiseppe B.

description:
the pizza tastes great, but it is a little too heavy.

parking is not all that great in this neighborhood
author: S M.

description: I only use this North Beach Pizza location for delivery and I am never disappointed! I am pretty picky with my pizza (I like more sauce than cheese) and they make it perfectly every time. Their deliveries are also very speedy!
author: Simona M.

description: Definitely a "meh" experience here. I can't quite pinpoint it, but I'd say it's a combination of an overall lackluster crust and under-seasoned sauce, which are basically the foundation to any half-decent pizza. ):
author: Chung N.

description:
When you order pizza for delivery, you really only care about 3 things: 

1) when is it getting here?
2) what's it taste like?
3) how do I get it?  

Well, it was a Saturday night and it took about one hour and twenty minutes.  A bit on the long side, but it was a weekend at prime time.  It tasted good, it was pizza.  Cheese, sauce, bread.  Only lactose intolerant people wont salivate at the sound of that.  The pizza wasn't my favorite, but I'll eat it again.  The last question though gets 5 stars.  Online ordering is my fourth favorite activity.  I'll admit, I'm actually good at it too.  Finding a pizza place that I can order a customized pizza, enter my credit, and not have to talk to anyone is awesome.  Reminds me of the Kozmo days.
author: Rob U.

description:
Someone once told me... Pizza is like Sex.. even when its not that good, its still pretty good!

 This particular location of North Beach Pizza serves pizza by the slice. Their Pizza by the Slice is the long lost lover you havent seen in six months, returned home, who knows and loves everything you like, and keeps you coming back for more. I dont know what it is... but pizza that has been sitting in a rotating glass case under a heating lamp is for some reason 10 times better then pizza delievered fresh to your door. 

Their delivery pizza however, for some strange reason, isnt nearly as good. Were talking "friend with benifits that you keep around beacuse you really wernt getting any anyways but hey, you were both bored at home on Thursday night". Its not as good as round table which I like for their consistancy, but not as bad as some mushy watered down pizzas ive been subjected to. 

Now if they would only stay open late enough for those 2am Friday Night cravings.... yes, were still talking about Pizza.
author: Aaron W.

description:
I'm used to hidden charges when I'm dealing with my credit card company or paying my cell phone bill, but not when I'm ordering a pizza.

I ordered from eat24hours.com and ordered a small pizza with pesto sauce. Their pesto is a consistently good buy here and did not disappoint once again but it is not good enough to warrant a 2 dollar charge when there was no indication on the online menu if there would be one. Someone even had a chance to inform me of the surplus charge when he called me to ask about the details of my order but did not.

Sorry North Beach, but my money is too valuable to be swindled into paying b.s. charges. 

PS Switching your pizza boxes that don't even say North Beach on them says a lot about your business practices.
author: Dillon M.

description: Haight area pizza taste test. Old school north beach. Lotta dough. Cheese and sauce pretty straight up. Connor gives it 5 stars.  He's 8.
author: Sean N.

description:
i work with the san francisco proam summer basketball league.  thats only why i eat this pizza.  well, i used to hate it.

now they have a new cook/chef or something.

NO PARKING around here even during the day...sad isn't it?

well the reason this place as taken a 4 star from me is the SAUCE THE SAUCE THE SAUCE its so tasty and fresh.  thats how its supposed to be.

back in the day this place had too much cheese.  Well IT IS CHEESY STILL.  Ask for half less and its still quite a bit.

The other thing i LOVE HERE is the SPAHGHETTI BOLOGNESE!  ITS TO LIVE FOR!  

I did ask for the sauce by itself and brought it home and boiled the pasty myself.  its not the same sauce...so you have to order the sauce and the spaghetti there.
author: Bing D.

description:
I opened the Valley Yellow pages to order a pizza ....
People always seem to say that North Beach Pizza is really good bla bla bla.
For some reason I have never had thier pizza until yesterday. 
We ordered for delivery and the pizza came promptly (45 min as quoted) but whenit did arrive ... not so good.
The pizza was really salty ... I could not figure out if it was the crust, the mozzarella or both but it was just really salty and soggy in the middle.
A good crust should stand up when you pick up the slice from the end... it should even be a little crispy... not this stuff.... sogorama!
I also didn't like the pepporoni they use.... it was almost sausage like in flavor... maybe some fennel in it ? 
Lastly the pizza itself was not topped or cheesed even close to the edge which I feel is another good sign of a great pie.... 
I won't be ordering from them again....
author: Jeremy R.

description: What a major disappointment.  I used to love North Beach Pizza; it was my favorite in the city.  The last 5-6 times I've ordered over the last two years, I've gotten a doughy, under cooked pizza with runny sauce and oily, limited amounts of cheese.  Even the Pepperoni must come from a different supplier.  Tonight was the last straw.  Terrible, won't be going back:  what a disappointment as this was my favorite place
author: jeff w.

description:
Worst pizza I've had in San Francisco.  Without a DIZZOUBT.  

Seriously, middle school called, they need their pizza (and sullen lunch lady) back.
author: Aaron K.

description: Pizza is one of my favorite foods and I'd have to say I really enjoy this place. Been here with the munchies a couple of times. The basil pizza is bomb and same with the plain cheese. Kinda weirded out that there is a bullet hole in one of the windows so I try to keep my visits quick. :)
author: Courtney S.

description: OK so its pretty obvious that people don't like this place, but I honestly don't think its that bad for what it is.  This is not a sit down pizza place, rather a take out or delivery.  The dough is pretty thick so if you like thin crust this probably isn't for you.  Also, the Verdi special is my favorite.  It has pesto, cheese, onions, its really good.  The mushroom and cheese is also pretty decent.  That's why I give this place a deserving 3.5 stars because of those two varieties of pizza I like.  I haven't tried any of the other food so I cannot comment on that.
author: Molly M.

description:
I am soo picky about pizza crusts. When I tried North Beach for the first time about 2 years ago I was smitten; it was the perfect crust for me! Not too thick, not too thin. 

Then a couple of months ago the pizza that I ordered had a weird crust, almost as though the dough had not been given enough time to rise so it was far too dense and inedible. No big deal, I figure- everyone has an off day. I ordered again the next week and the dough was the same way. 

Since I'm a total sucker, I gave them once last chance a couple weeks ago. Same deal. Everything else seems the same to me but it's as though they've just decided to screw up the crust entirely. Now it tastes like your average chain restaurant pizza crust, only Papa John's has cheaper prices for the same quality. I'm really disappointed by this since they were my favorite pizza place in town. Someone let me know when they stop screwing around with their crusts and go back to something edible!
author: Rachael E.

description:
Best pizza I've had in SF without a doubt. When I'm watching my Chargers lose at Kezar Pub (I'm not going back... they lose whenever I watch them at Kezar), at half time I go get a slice or two from North Beach down the street.

Slices of pepperoni are doughy, delicious, and I think $2. It's simple, good tasting, bad for me, but soooo yummy.
author: Bryan Z.

description:
First let me say that I'm absolutely not a pizza expert. I'm allergic to cheese, and had pizza a total of 4 times. 

This being said, my husband and I decided to get ourselves a pizza, half with cheese, half without. Don't waste my time blabbering about the unholiness of cheese-less pizza, I've heard it all.. really!

Getting to the point here:

We ordered a pizza, it took well over an hour to get here, which in itself seemed rather long. The pizza was ok-ish at best. The sauce was very bland, as a matter of fact we added spices, salt and pepper to our pieces to make them taste like something. The slices were also very limp. 

Honestly, I wasn't expecting a pizza from Shakespeare (Columbia, MO), but I was certainly hoping for something better than what we got, even more since it was far from being a cheap pizza. 

Maybe it was an off-night, but I was greatly unimpressed. 

On the plus side, ordering it over the phone was very easy and hassle free. I thought I'd mention is since many people seem to have had bad experiences ordering, we didn't. Phone service was friendly, easy and quick.
author: Willow K.

description: I actually never eaten at one of their restaurant.  I've always ordered from North Beach Pizza.  The delivery is prompt since they have multiple locations throughout the city. They've came through for me when I came home too late to cook on numerous occasions.  On top of that, you end with left overs, even better!
author: S F.

description:
I'd say it's a toss up between North Beach Pizza and Escape from NY for the best pie in San Fran.  Because North Beach made it into my cell phone for some reason, they nearly always end up getting my business. 

Try a pesto and artichoke heart pizza.  Simply to die for (see my last meal).
author: Ian L.

description: Quick order processing and we are regular customers.  Usually I would consider them to be four stars, but tonight the crust was just completely blah and the cheese foundation too thin to provide the pizza fun.  Will give them another chance, but I hope this was a one bad night scenario.
author: Michael E.

description: The best by the slice pizza in San Francisco. Also really good for take out/delivery. Stanyan location is by far the best one.
author: Marty F.

description: A generic american pizza place. A little pricey for a full pizza, but the toppings are amazing. There is a whole lot of variety that will compensate a great pizza. Fast delivery.
author: Peter G.

description: Ordered a cheese slice.  In the countertop warmer is one cheese pizza that's all fresh looking and missing 2 slices.  On another level is a different cheese pie with only a couple of slices left. And it totally looks like yesterday's leftovers.  So the d-bag behind the counter gives me one of the crappy old slices...after two bites I returned it.
author: paul a.

description:
HORRIBLE, NO-GOOD, BAD PIZZA PLACE!!!

PLEASE READ THIS IN FULL, AND NEVER GIVE THEM A DIME.
I'll be reporting them to the Better Business Bureau after this...

I'm sure the pizza is great.
maybe even delicious.
but the staff, the delivery man, manager, and OWNER, had the audacity to verbally accost me, tear me apart, treat me like a piece of scum, a filthy animal, as follows...

It's Wednesday night. Me and the roommates are hungry. We order delicious sausage and pepperoni pizza.
An hour later the pizza arrives. I tip the delivery man well, excited for my pizz. When I open the box... the pizza is COLD, not what I ordered (just cheese), and IS MISSING 3 SLICES. I repeat, the pizza is MISSING 3 SLICES. So, confused and slightly humored, I call North Beach and explain that although it may seem odd, I have the wrong pizza and can they please send me another one. 

The woman on the phone says "No"
I say: "Excuse Me?"
Pizza Woman: "No. You're lying. That's impossible. I can't believe you'd call in with such an outlandish excuse."
Me (flabbergasted): "I would like to talk to a manager please"

The manager gets on, laughing, and tells me that I'm absolutely ridiculous for thinking they'd believe such a story and they will not, under no circumstances give me a pizza. Utterly amazed and completely floored, I go into great detail about how I'm absolutely not making this up and I can't believe that they're treating me, THE CUSTOMER, with such disrespect. The manager says "well we do things differently here." (interpretation: "we don't give a flying f*ck about you). She goes on for awhile, and now, nearly in tears, I ask to speak to the owner.

5 minutes later the owner gets on and essentially repeats what the manager says only in harsher terms, and tells me that it would be best if I just never stepped foot in their restaurant again. EXCUSE ME??? She essentially RIPS ME TO PIECES, going on and on about what a liar I am and how I must be a fool to try to lie about my pizza just to get a free one. 
Sobbing, I hang up. 

I march to the pizza place. Place the wrong pizza on the counter, and storm out.

An hour later I have a voice-mail from the delivery man stating that they were wrong, there was a mix-up, they'll deliver a new one. 
NO REAL APOLOGY.
NO APOLOGY FROM THE OWNER.
and since I was gone when they attempted delivery, NO NEW PIZZA.

I'm disgusted and outraged. I feel completely violated and disrespected. FROM A PIZZA PLACE. 

PLEASE DON'T EAT HERE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
author: C W.

description: A word of advice - don't ever order a pie with extra cheese, because the standard amount they use is about a pound and a half more than anyone else. This is pizza you need to eat with a knife and fork, because they're very generous with the toppings, and they understand what I mean when I say I prefer a thick crust. As close as I live to them, home delivery still can be agonizingly slow. (When I want pizza, I want it NOW!) More expensive than most, but generally worth it.
author: Gourmet G.

description: The pizza from the original North Beach Pizza, the one in North Beach, is really good.  The pizza from the Haight-Ashbury North Beach Pizza is mediocre.  Actually, it's more meh.  OK, so it was only meh that one time.  But it's definitely mediocre.
author: John S.

description:
Who knew Barbeque sauce and pizza could make such sweet love? I am downright smitten with the Barbary Coast Special at North Beach Pizza. It comes with chicken, green onion, red onion, and (drum roll please...) bacon! Bacon makes everything better and bbq sauce doesn't suck. The combo is out of this world. I have a theory that they mix the bbq sauce into their tradtional sweet, tangy homemade pizza sauce (or maybe they also make the bbq sauce from scratch and the recipes bear some similarity) and that's what you get underneath the just-right blanket of cheese and scattering of meats and onions. For their other pizzas, see other reviews. I don't know anything about the other pizzas. I don't cheat on the chicken. 
FYI- I can vouch for their veg lasagna. It is a fairly generous serving- two large rectangles side-by-side, smothered in marinara and cheeses. Mmmm...and the salad that comes with it (for an extra dollar or two) is a pretty big side salad with tomatoes and cucumbers and carrots. I like this location a lot better than the Grant Street store. The Barbary Coast Pizza isn't as good from Grant. Order from the Stanyan location and pick it up if they don't deliver to your hood.
author: Autumn K.

description:
North Beach Pizza is a fairly unremarkable pizza place.  Actually, we found several hairs in our pizza; that was remarkable, I guess.  

Good things: they deliver, you can order online (always a good thing, as I usually won't order food for delivery unless I can order online), crust tasted good, delivery was pretty fast, and veggies were fresh. 

Bad things: a bit too much cheese and a bit too much hair.

I don't think I'll order from North Beach Pizza again.  Good delivery pizza sure is hard to find.
author: Alyson Y.

description: North Beach Pizza provides one of my preferred pies in the city. While not the best, it most certainly a happy standard. As mentioned by other reviewers, NBP is all about the sauce. Spicy and delicious. I also very much enjoy the larger breadier crust. I realize I am very much in the minority on that one. The Haight street location is the worst of the lot. They seem to only stay open until 7pm or so, or maybe they just never want to deliver. Also I am not sure if they are open in the afternoon either, really I am not convinced any pizza making is happening at this location. I do know odds are you will not be getting delivery from them at ANY time. The North Beach and Mission locations are solid. North Beach pizzas tend to range wildly in quality. When the pizza is on, its really really good. but when its off, it becomes average at best. My rating applies to the good pies I get from NBP, I will always have a craving for those.
author: Christopher N.

description: North Beach (in North Beach) used to be one of the best ever, since they expanded to various parts of the city; not so good.  Why so we pay all our money for "not bad" all the time?.  Most obvious is the quality of cheese most these places seem to use.  Is it 100% real?
author: John C.

description: shitty service. ordered two hours ago and they never showed, then said I never ordered.
author: justin r.

description: This is really a 3.5. Decent pizza, serviceable salads, good pasta, ok meatballs, good sandwiches. This is a solid place for lunch or dinner. To grab a slice, I would go another block to haight for Escape from NY, but for variety Italian food, this is a good go to place. I have never been wowed or disappointed with a meal here, and always satisfied. I do have a fondness in my heart for their toasted meat ravioli which come with marinara sauce for dipping.
author: Aimee B.

description: This place makes some of the WORST pizza I have ever had in my LIFE: spongy, doughy, oily and WAY too much cheese.  In terms of personal interaction, the most you'll ever get from any of the employees there is a grunt of reluctant acknowledgment.  The only excuse I have for ever going there is that it is directly around the corner from my apartment, and when staggering home drunk from a night out, it is often the only place still open within my immediate area.  And even then, I regret going!  The last time I tried this (just earlier this week), I ended up taking a few bites & throwing out the rest in disgust.  For pizza, it's actually worth going the few extra blocks to Escape From New York, on Haight St.  You can actually get a decent slice there.
author: Eric H.

description: Love the pizza here - definitely try the Cable Car specialty pizza!  I've walked past the actual joint which seems pretty small - I've only used their delivery service.  Also tried the lasagne - pretty salty if you ask me.  Got hypertension?  Beware!
author: K P.

description:
Oh wow COLD pizza picked up for $26.00!!
Kinda expensive for something like papa johns, but it was supposed to be picked up HOT. never again ugh
author: Daniel H.

description: I have eaten pizza here on some of the drunkest nights of my life.  With that said, I don't really remember the quality of the pizza but during those times all I remember is that it was the "best pizza in the WHOLE WORLD."  The guys that work there seem to always put up with me stumbling into their recently closed business with flowers in my hair that I've so lovingly pulled from their potted plants outside.  Most of the time I think they give me the pizza for free, maybe trying to get rid of me.
author: Allison K.

description: Ordered two pies and was told that it would take up to 45 minutes. To our disgust, it took closer to TWO hours!!!!  Each time we called for an update the guy acted as if I was needy and rude.  Anyway, ignoring the fact that they were late, the pies were average and definitely not worth the price
author: upimerOO P.

description:
I had the worst pizza experience of my life with this place yesterday. In a hung-over-pizza-needing craze, my friends and I ordered from North Beach Pizza with high expectations based on our past experiences. We were BRUTALLY dissapointed. After waiting, stomachs growling, for an hour and a half... we finally called to see where the hell our pizza was. We were told that it would be there in a few minutes and another half an hour later the doorbell finally rang. Forgetting our frustration about the ridiculous wait and the fact that the delievery guy had no parmasean or peppers with him, we anxiously dove into the pizza only to find that it was barely edible. It was obvious that theyd completely forgot about our pizza and rather then making us another one, they took the one that had been sitting there that hour and a half, re-covered it with cheese and reheated it. So the crust of the pizza was the only part that was cut. And despite this, it was still cold! And our Diet Cokes that we'd ordered with it, turned out to be the splenda kind. A completely different taste.

I always thought that when you were that hungry anything tasted good. I was proven wrong.
author: Taylor E.

description: The last two times I ordered Pizza from here, it has arrived very melted on top, but the dough is uncooked and gooey where it's thick.  Wouldn't really recommend it, seems like they are too quick to try to get it out the door.
author: Reed M.

description: It's not east coast pizza, but this place has definitely grown on me.  The crust is thick, which means that sometimes it has a tendency to be undercooked and doughy, but when they get the crust right this is a pretty good cheese slice for only $2.50.
author: Jen W.

description: Tried out their online order system, I ordered pick-up at the mission street location, but it requires you to enter your address. Stanyan location calls to clarify, since I'm closer to stanyan, why order from mission location, I told them because I was going to a friends spot out in the mission and I was going to pick it up there. Then they'll call mission to make the order. WHAT!!!, I ordered the mission location, but it bypassed to stanyan because of my address, and apparently stanyan started to make the order even though I did not order from their location.
author: Robin L.

description: I was at this restaurant on Friday night and I ordered spaghetti with garlic bread. It was excellent. I've always enjoyed their pizza and now I love their spaghetti. Thanks again guys.
author: Alex W.

description: I like North Beach Pizza.  Probably one of the better places to go for traditional pizza options in the city (i.e. pepperoni pizza, sausage pizza, pizza with mushrooms, etc.)  The specialty pizzas I've tried from here haven't lived up to the high standards I set for my pizza (I take pizza very seriously).  The clam pizza may have honestly been one the worst thing I've ever tried in my whole life, but then it was a pizza with clams on it - the existence of which kinda defies all reasonable explanation.
author: Matthew H.

description: Oh, North Beach. You get two stars for existing pretty much. I lived down the street from here for two years, and I appreciate NB for providing me with pizza when I was drunk, or too lazy to cook dinner. COLLEGE! But, the pizza is still sub-par, probably a 2 1/2-3 out of five on their best day. Pass on this and go to Escape from New York instead.
author: Samantha M.

description: So far I've been having difficulty finding really good pizza in this city, and I know I'm not alone. Well this is pretty good pizza. It's not quite Pepe's or Abate, actually not even close, but it's pretty darn good. And I think it's much better than Escape from New York. I'm still looking though. While I am looking, this isn't a bad option.
author: Barbs J.

description: Ok, I haven't recently discovered why everyone has been going on and on about North Beach pizza for all these years. Because they are f'ing good!! My new favorite that my roommate turned me on to is the Pepperoni and tomatoe combo. Everything about it makes me drool. P.S.- How cute are their delivery men ( not in the young strapping men kind of way).
author: Erin O.

description: OK, I've only eaten here once, but the pizza was very good and the staff was nice. I was visiting a friend who lives in the neighborhood and who comes here every Friday night to pick up pizza (maybe that's why they were so nice). Good thin crust, not overtoppinged (yes, it is now a word), and good sauce. Having 2 margaritas first didn't hurt either.
author: Mike I.

description: A pizza place that has all the makings of being a hole-in-the-wall favorite. It's always packed, standing room only, and not exactly the cleanest. People huddle around greasy counters, scarfing down food to avoid the cold NorCal winds. It even has that requisite guy at the counter who gives off that blase, I'm-too-cool-for-this-yet-simultaneously-cool-because-I-work-here vibe associated with many a low key joint. The only thing is the pizza sucks. Not enough tomato sauce.
author: Erika C.

description: Great za...loads of toppings...quick delivery.  Enough said.
author: Eduardo A.

description:
Terrible pizza.  I feel like their quality has dropped significantly over the past few months.  

Twice I've barfed from eating here.  Both times, I felt fine until 15 minutes after eating a slice.  Maybe the quality of the delivery pizza is better than thier slices, but I'm done w/ this place.  It's a real shame too b/c they're near my home and on my way home from the muni.

Another small comment - I feel the cashier is rude the way he announces "three" instead of a more customary, customer-service friendly request for three dollars.
author: WP D.

description: NBP - Just perfect for after happy hour treat! My friends and I really needed a boost to get us rallying after a very successful happy hour at Pier 23. North Beach Pizza was the ticket! Though it took almost an hour for them to deliver, the pizza was worth the wait.
author: Allison B.

description: From time to time, our office gets pizza crazy and we order pizzas galore from North Beach. They are extremely efficient in their deliveries and we have never waited more than 45 minutes for the pizza to arrive. The pizzas arrive piping hot and are always a hit! Be forewarned though ---- these pizzas are generously loaded with cheese and delicious toppings that you may need a fork and knife to et your slice. My favorite is the North Beach special --- it is loaded with pepperoni, sausage, bell peppers, olives and onions. (You must be drooling, huh?!) Me too! hahaha.......Maybe this office needs another pizza lunch. I'm gonna start planning! Peace...
author: La C.

description: The only time I've ever thought this pizza was great was after a night out drinking.  But, really, what isn't great at that point.  During my unintoxicated visits I've only though the pizza was mediocre at best.  The pesto pizza is pretty good, but all their pizzas seem too dry.  I can really only recommend this place after midnight while at least slightly inebriated.
author: Jeff S.

description: Great, fast delivery.  Best crust in the city.  Their veggies are always fresh, and the meat isn't dry like it is at Orgasmica.  I've never been inside, but we get them to drop one off almost every week.  And it's cheaper than orgasmica.
author: Jimmy C.

description: Moved back in to SF and this is the most familiar (albeit not best) place  I could locate nearby to deliver. Apparently there are a few good places around here, but at the height of my laziness I went with North Beach purely for the order online thing. Their pizza tastes about the same at all the locations. This one in particular only took about 30mins, was HOT, but was a little sloppy and drippy. Meh oh well. The biggest bummer, although small, is my PLEASE SEND NAPKINS, PLATES, AND PARMESAN, HALP!! made it onto the receipt, so I know they got my comments, but at some point between the hand off and/or the drop off, I got none of these lovely (and HELPFUL, considering I just moved in) items.  Meh. Oh well.
author: Michelle W.

description: North Beach is reliably fine. I like the variety of menu items outside of pizza - the spaghetti is actually pretty good, and the lasagna, while a bit on the oily/cheesey side, is as well. If you're a thick crust type, the pizza has appeal. But blotters beware - there can be a lot of grease to soak up. My favorite pizza combo is tomato and basil, which is tastily baked in. My biggest gripe is their delivery time - you can count on 45 minutes to an hour, sometimes a little worse - ouch.
author: Kiesha R.

description: I love the mushroom slices in this little standing-room-only slice joint in the Upper Haight.  The prices are cheap and the pizza is scrumptious.  Yum.
author: Apollo L.

description: This is a great place for a slice---quick in , $3.25, quick out!   The pizza is nothing to write home about, it won't wow you!  But the guys work hard there and it's super close for me.  DON'T BLOCK the driveways if you park.  You can actually double park (on Beullah) and the cops will leave you alone, but they will ticket you or tow you quick if you block driveways.  Also, there's Kezar bar down the street for a good brew and some sports watching...  They close earlier now than before...
author: Mark K.

description: There is nothing worse in this world than a wanna-be pizza, and that is exactly what North Beach Pizza serves. They are overpriced.....their sauce taste like it straight out of a Chef Boyardee can, and their cheese can even be held in question whether or not it is out of a can. The crust reminded me of those nasty Tony's frozen pizzas your Mother used to buy because they were three for five bucks. I doubt if any of the employees here are even of Italian descent. This establishment, however, suits the customer whom has absolutely no standards or taste when eating out . Arrivederci.
author: Kenny G.

description: I admit it! I had menu-lock, and the guys here were staring at me, and there were people in line, and I couldn't think! This was worse than Top Dog or Blondies! I went on auto-pilot, and ordered a small sausage, olive and mushroom even though it was just for me and I was staying in a hotel. What was I thinking? Thank gosh, I wasn't because the pizza was stunning! Heavy on the cheese, lively crust, huge pieces of sausage, and the marinara sauce was not overpowering. WOW! I was a P-I-G and ate half the pizza that night. I chucked it out on the fire escape, and the next morning, had great pizza, again! I wish we had pizza like this in Salinas!
author: Alice G.

description: I grab a couple slices here from time to time on the way home, but they're usually cold and mostly dough, not many toppings for $3 a slice.  The dough is good, but I don't suggest buying by the slice from here unless you're starved and in a hurry.
author: Simon B.

description: I really love the Pizza here, so far it's the best delivery pizza I've found in SF, though i admit that there aren't a ton of options. The entrees are also decent, though i recommend skipping the side pasta, it tends to be a little overdone. The hoagies are respectable as well. The only thing i have problems with are the Buffalo Wings, but i suppose getting good Buffalo Wings from an Italian/Pizza joint may be asking a bit too much. If you're a meat lover, I recommend a Sausage and Pepperoni Pizza. The cheese is extra thick and it's almost as good the next morning.
author: Manlio L.

description: I've had North Beach Pizza a whole bunch of times at work, and I always thought it was very yummy.  My work would always order pizza and salad for some "special occasion" and we would order aboiut 4 pizzas, which fed about 15 people.  I don't exsactly remember what was on the pizzas...I know one was pepperoni, another was cheese, another was veggies of some kind, and the last was full of meats.  You see, I was too busy eating the pizzas, not paying attention to what was on it, because it was yummy.  I would definately recommend this place to anyone.
author: Lisa H.

description: Damn good pizza, just put a little less cheese on there... I don't need to spend a week running off my dinner.
author: James C.

description: excellent pizza and best in SF i've had. I personally like big, floppy NY style cheese pizza the best and while north beach pizza is definitely NOT that,  the style of pizza they do--thicker crust, gourmet topping choices, etc--is delicious. I have been unable to find a true, good NY style pizza here so for SF I content myself with what I consider 2nd best and North Beach Pizza is the tops here.
author: Snora E.

description:
updated 3/14/2010

so, the last few visits have changed.  the guys at the counter seem ever so slightly more willing to help me.

the price i think may have gone up?  not sure.  i think it was $3 for a pesto slice, not $3.50.
and, the slice is now considerably smaller than before.

good pie, but i'll go down to san bruno to ray's inside sajj for my pesto pie fix from now on.
author: Mom Of Three L.

description: we ordered a large NB special for the NFC & AFC championship games yesterday and was it special?  well if you consider the fact that all of us got sick and were on the toilet for most of day and night special?  then have at it, never again!  :{
author: Pickle R.

description: it's hard to make pizza so bad that it's nt really worth eating, but north beach somehow accomplishes this questionable feat. after having been forcibly subjected to it too many times at work, i think i attribute this travesty to three main failings: mushy, doughy crust, too-sweet sauce and plasticky cheese. yuck.
author: Erica W.

description: ewwww. the pizza was ok, but the cheese all comes off with one bite. my buddy who owns several pizza stores says that means they use "cheap" cheese. the wings were cold which made them virtually uneatable until we put it in the oven. me and my buddies were drunk and lit and this did not fulfill my munchies requirements. pass...
author: Andrew T.

description: i was very disappointed by north beach pizza. they only had mushroom, cheese, pesto and sausage. the toppings were scarce. the pizza was blah. nothing special to it. and it was $3.00 a slice. i regretted spending my 3 dollars!
author: Cindy L.

description: ok....granted...they're open till 12 or 1 am....so if you have munchies, bless their hearts they are open....but the slices....sitting there all day drying out, and the sauce without any flavor and the breading that looks like consitency of your shoe sole rubber......one could eat there if they were drunk...wait a min.....I actually lost half of my tooth eating one of them slices....I guess it's all about the dough...lol....wasn't that funny when I had to get a root canal....North Beach should pay my dentist bill.....sorry guys....just don't cut it....
author: Alex W.

description: These guys rock when it comes to large deliveries!  I've ordered for 150 - 250 people before and they are awesome.  They call to give you a 5 minute warning so you can meet them outside.  They allow you to pre-pay the tip and everything way in advance.  The pizza comes hot and the soda cans come cold!  I will never order a large pizza order from anyone else in the city, the North Beach Pizza guys rock!
author: Shannon N.

description: OK, so good thing about this place is that they deliver til real late, like 2am and if you wanted, you could order one of their specialty fancy pizzas.  You know, the ones that have stuff on pizza that shouldn't be on pizza...like asparagus, or pheasant, or buffalo meat...you know, crazy ingredients like that.  So we order a large specialty pizza (can't remember the name but it had chicken and BBQ sauce).  It was like $25 which was pretty high for a fancy pizza and when it came it didn't seem fully cooked since the middle was all soggy.  Plus, the guy that I talked to on the phone to make the order was a complete stoner so I was worried that I might be getting a totally wrong order.  Plus the pizza wasn't that great, kinda tasted like Dominos.  I would've given this place 2 stars but I'll leave it at 3 since they deliver til late.  Good for those stay-in nights getting really high off bong hits and needing that late night munchy food.
author: David C.

description: I ordered cheese ravioli for delivery from the website. When it arrived it cost $2 more than it said on the website and it was just a handful of ravioli. They tasted good, but I was still hungry! Either lower the price or increase the portion. Rip off.
author: Sara T.

description: Soggy and bland. I've only had their takeout, though, so maybe it's different if you are eating in.
author: A. T.

description: i'm so torn. i want to give 1 star, but it's not terrible here...just barely edible. 'edible' meaning nothing special with a LOT of drawbacks!   GREEAASSSSSYYYYYY!! HELLLO PEOPLE...Learn to make a pizza that doesn't deteriorate your cardboard box! Soggy if it sits for more than 30seconds.  Delivery is dependable...can't hate on them there.  1 extra star for the bald headed troll stunt double delivery guy...he obviously has kids to feed.  help him out and get a mercy pizza if you're desperate.
author: jim a.

description: Pretty good for the most part, but the pizzas are nothing spetacular.  I do like their large selection of pastas that are pretty cheap and tasty.  My favorite is the tortellini with ham and cream sauce.  Buffelo wings decent but overpriced.  The only thing is it takes about an hour (or more depending on how busy they are) for your food to be delivered to you (once my pizza was lukewarm when it got to me), so might not be the best option if you're starving and want something fast.
author: N T.

description: if you want good pizza, go a few blocks away to escape from new york. i knew the pizza was bad already, but i figured i'd give their wings and subs a shot. bad idea. the wings were soft and slimy and the sub was small, the bread tasted stale. where can i get good wings and chicken parm subs around here?
author: Chris C.

description: if you like waiting almost two hours for your delivery, only to receive cold pasta, cold pizza with congealed cheese, and a rude delivery guy, this is your place! had to cancel our movie b/c our dinner took so damn long to come. called a couple times, but got a very annoying "they're on their way" from whoever answered the phone. ridiculously bad service, and obviously, cold late food was not so tasty to our tummies either...
author: erica r.
